Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am glad you enjoyed our hotel sand services. We are in final phase of elevator modernization that will be completed very soon, as well.

Summary: I found the hotel to be nice, but the service was what sold me.  The rooms had recently been upgraded, but the hallway carpets were tired and worn.  I would stay here again, but not my first choice in the region.

We stayed at this hotel for Cal State Fullertons commencement.  The hotel was very busy, as expected but one of the two elevators were out, causing a huge delay to getting to our rooms.  Carpets throughout the Halls are worn, lobby chairs uncomfortable and seem old at the bar area.  The rooms are nice, however it took us two moves before getting to a room that was sufficable. The first room had a broken light that was not repairable, second was the wrong room set up.  Really dissapointed, would rather stay at the Holiday Inn up the road.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We take matters such as this very seriously. I apologize for elevator being out of service. We our modernizing our elevators. Our guestroom corridor carpet is new but will investigate opportunity to better clean so thank you for your feedback. I have spoken with our operations team to ensure we correct and further train our team members to prevent and fix all potential broken items. I hope you will consider giving our hotel another chance to exceed your expectations!

Summary: Well appointed hotel.  Love that there is wood not carpet in bedroom.  Very specious and tasteful. Well located to Fullerton and Anaheim. Amenities nice with outdoor seating areas and indoor pool and gym

I stayed there for a three days business trip. Let me say this, the hotel is great for business travels, Internet connection is fast. They offer a wide range of breakfast options. The bar and bar food is great. Rooms are large. Really all you need when you travel for business.

Since my initial review of the Fullerton Marriott we have stayed 2 additional times, one stay in August 2016 and one in June 2017.  Each stay has been very good.  Each time we have opted for concierge level and in the August 2016 visit when we accessed the concierge lounge at the latter portion of their evening hour the hostess apologized for the food being eaten up and called down to the kitchen to whip something up for us.  This was totally unexpected but greatly appreciated.  On our more recent visit they were undergoing renovations on the upper levels so the concierge level was temporarily on the 4th floor.  Again everything was very welcoming.  Each stay we have had we have encountered helpful and upbeat personnel from the housekeeping staff, the food services, the

Work travel brings me to Fullerton often. This by far is my favorite place to stay! The hotel itself is nice, and the restaurant is great. Though my favorite thing about it is the customer service, they treat me like family. Specifically I love any time I get to see Breann at the front desk. Thanks for making work travel so comfortable and friendly!

Nice hotel. Newly renovated rooms are great. Busy place. Free parking. Close to plenty of restaurants. It was a 20 minute drive to the convention center. The staff was really nice. Good food in the lobby. Comfy beds.  Nice linens. Good water pressure.

Summary Heading: It's my fault for giving this place another chance...
Summary: Ok, now it's my fault since I gave this place another chance.  Stayed Feb 16, 2018 because the rate was pretty good and other hotels in the area were really high since it was President's Day Weekend.  I shouldn't have been seduced.  Arrived at 4pm, stood in a line of 10 people waiting to check in with only one clerk at the desk, the phone ringing endlessly off the hook.  Tried to avert this by checking in with Marriott app but it said I had to wait an hour to use it to check in (???).  I was told it was a nicer room because of my status with Marriott, and the room was nice enough, but it was next to the pool.  There were some teams of children staying at the hotel, couldn't tell what sport, and they basically were in the pool screaming from the time I checked until sometime
Manager Response: Dear jtk10012,  First and foremost I'd like to apologize for the issues you experienced during your stay. I can certainly understand your frustration as you endured issues from start to finish. Mobile check in is a great tool used to speed up the arrival experience. There are a few conditions that coincide with the app in particular with the timing of the arrival which must be a minimum of one hour away from the current time which is why you received that notification. As we move forward we will be providing our guests with "mobile key" which allows the guest access to the room without having to stop by at the desk at all.   In addition to this, we do the best to provide all of our guests an excellent stay by providing features and amenities such as our pool. Our closing time is at 10pm and we abide by the time to assure that our guests near by can enjoy a good night's rest. We tahnk you for your feedback and will certainly look to improve upon them.

Summary Heading: Very nice but only one working elevator
Summary: Our room was very nice,although we’d prefer two queens instead of two double beds.  The lobby has lots of great seating areas and the breakfast buffet service is excellent.  Our only critical feedback is the restaurant offered no gluten free cereal options, like Chex.  How hard is it to consider GF guest needs, when they have 5 different cereals?  Also, only one elevator works so it’s a bit slow trying to get to your room. Word is the other elevator has not been working for months while they replace it.  Otherwise great stay.

The hotel is walking distance to CSU Fullerton.  Parking and WiFi are free.  Breakfast came with my rate.  The bed is very comfortable.  Refrigerator in my room.  One cup coffee maker.  They have a one button on the phone to get anything, front desk-room service-etc.  I tried that line three times over a half hour period and got a busy signal, so they need to do something about that.  It’s a nice hotel, just that one flaw this visit.
Manager Response: Dear Hitcher84,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your precious stay. Rest assure that our team will look into the problem you experienced. I can certainly understand how frustrating that may have been to continuously receive the busy signal. I'm pleased to hear that you enjoyed our renovated room and that our location worked well for you. We hope to better serve you during your future travels to the city of Fullerton.

Summary: I had stayed here a few years ago, just in the middle of the upgrade. Good staff and good service. My issues are with the building itself. I should have guessed I was in for trouble when my first room was right next to the elevator and the worlds noisiest ice machine  1) What, the rooms are not carpeted, just hard floors 2) ac/ unit incredibly loud 3) return air grill in bath extraordinarily loud. Enough velocity to suck a bowling ball off the floor (lol) I covered it over with amen it shut it off. 4) Breakfast on Sunday. Every one is in the weeds. You know they are behind when the Chef comes out of the kitchen to start bussing tables. Breakfast took over an hours

I've passed by this Marriott for years, but always thought it was too close to the 57 freeway to be a place I'd want to stay. However when I needed to visit Cal State Fullerton, the parking hassle at the college has gotten to be ridiculous so I decided to give it a shot, both because of the free parking at the hotel and I could walk across the street to campus.  And I'm quite glad I did.   In my special request with my reservation, I asked for a room NOT facing the freeway. When I checked in, I was assured I was in a quiet location. Imagine my shock when I got to my room and it was indeed facing the 57. Knowing that you don't get 100% of what you don't ask for, I returned to front desk to explain the situation. Nicole, who checked me in, took a few moments and found me a another

Have been staying there for a number of years now, and since they have remodeled the hotel, it is very, very nice. Rooms have been upgraded and the rates were extremely reasonable for a full service Marriott.

I’ve stayed at hundreds of Marriott properties over the years, and this was one of my favorite properties.   It’s an older hotel that’s been totally renovated top to bottom and is beautiful. The rooms are totally modern and fresh and have a lot of AC by Marriott vibe with great bathrooms.   Totally can’t wait to stay here again.

The property is a bit old, but well kept. The size of this Marriott is not as big as your typical full service Marriott, but it gets the job done. Currently going through some renovations. When I was there, they replaced my TV with a bigger one in the middle of my stay.  Rooms are pretty standard in terms of size, but clean and comfortable.   Rooms are being upgraded with hardwood floors, and bathrooms are refreshed.   The concierge lounge was closed for service when I was there (New Years), but was able to go in to take a look. It is a bit on the small side, and it wasn't open on the non-Holidays when I was there.   Fitttness area is also a bit small, several treadmills and 2 ellipticals and one bike, and a cable machine in a cornor.  Overall, it is currently a smaller scale

I recently stayed here for work. I had a note on my reservation for no feathers, it brings on severe allergies. I even asked upon check in and was told it had been taken care of. I woke around 1am having an asthma attack, checked and pillows were feather. I called the front desk and they said they couldn't help me. I even brought it up on checking out, was told I would be compensated, and a manage would contact me.  Ten days later no communication, no apology or compensation. Not only can they not deal with customer requests, they have zero follow up....disgusting service!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Stevens,  It was a pleasure speaking with you this afternoon. Once again I'd like to apologize for the delay in responding back to your concerns. Rest assure that we take all of your feedback and experience to heart and will learn from this experience. Please let us know if there is anything that we can do for you and we hope to better serve you during your next visit to the city of Fullerton.

Summary: This may not be the biggest Marriotts, but it was the most welcoming and friendliest I have ever stayed in.  The desk clerk on that particular day I checked it was so cheerful, with an up-beat attitude and a great asset to the hotel. Everyone on staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful.  My room had been newly remodeled and I loved the hardwood floors instead of carpet. Rooms are clean and comfortable, with plenty of towels and hot water in the shower!  Location Is very good with a small food court across the street. I will definitely stay here again!

Fullerton Marriott –  We needed a room for one additional night and could not extend our reservation in Anaheim to start earlier so thought that the Marriott in Fullerton would be a good choice.  This hotel is located across the street from the college and about 7 miles away from our ultimate destination in Anaheim.  When we arrived on Wednesday Jan 3, there was only one person assigned to the front desk.  She had “trainee” on her name tag was tied up with a guest for quite some time while others checking in had to wait.  After about 10 minutes or so, a second person arrived (not a trainee) and began checking the rest of us in.  We were given a recently renovated room (#441) which faced the parking lot at the back of the building and Interstate 57.  The positive points about
Manager Response: Chris F Thank you for taking the time to provide such detailed feedback about your recent stay. We most certainly appreciate the feedback of our guests, it allows us to better ourselves in areas in which require improvement. I am happy to hear that you appreciated the newly renovated room, but clearly there are areas in which we still need to excel in regards to the rooms. I will speak with my Executive Housekeeping Manager about the cleanliness of the floors.   As we wrap up the completion of the guestroom renovation, our next focus is going to be on another area that you had mentioned: the elevators. We are undergoing a complete modernization of the elevators that is slated to start in mid-February after the completion of the rooms. So we are looking forward to providing continued new and improved products to our guest. We certainly hope that you stay with us again to experience the changes that are being made.   Thank you again!

Summary Heading: This was a good stay but there was some disturbances.
Summary: I just gave an average but not excellent because the Stay was good but the Place was under renovation and there was not water the next day for half a day. That troubled you a bit but the stay was good but there was more dust at that point of time. Hope this will be good by 2018 (Completing all its renovations).
Manager Response: Good evening pradeepm488,  Thank you for feedback on your previous stay. As mentioned we are currently undergoing a renovation to our rooms and hallways. We are projecting to complete the renovation by mid January of 2018. We understand the impact this plays to the overall experience and are looking forward to finishing the renovation. I truly apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced and look forward to your next visit to the city of Fullerton.

Summary Heading: Great Location to Cal State Fullerton
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights for business. Room 201 is a large room with a view of the pool and the side street, as it has windows at both ends. Has a nice desk space to work. Room was clean, beds are comfortable. Items needed in the room would be a safe and refrigerator. The hotel is currently going through room renovations so it was a little loud during the day with construction noise.

I recently stayed here using a free Marriott night and chose this hotel because it has a concierge lounge and is not too far from Disneyland (less than fifteen minutes).  The renovations are still in progress and I got a renovated room, which has a modern, sleek vibe.  All carpet had been removed from the room and it is now a hard surface.  The king bed was exceptionally comfortable.  On the sixth floor the ice machine and the soda machine are not enclosed in a utility room as per most hotels at which I've stayed, and the ice machine's motor was unusually loud so be sure to avoid the rooms next to it.  The concierge lounge is small, but adequate. It is not really up to the standards of other lounges I have been to at other Marriott hotels, but it served its purpose.  This hotel

Great location, was in town to see a musical at the college, which is right next door. Front desk and wait staff were very friendly.  Asked for late check out which was nice 1pm.  Free parking, right off the freeway.

The lobby has been redone and is lovely.  The rooms are not all redone but are clean and a nice size. Across the street from the university which is handy.  Food service in the lounge didn't seem to be staffed properly.  Front desk staff was delightful.
Manager Response: Dear ScarlettHippie,  Thank you for sharing your comments and feedback from your previous stay. As you touched on, we are currently in the process of finishing our renovation. We have two floors that are completed and will be receiving a third floor back within the coming days. This presents a difficult challenge but we are excited with the progress made and look forward to the end result. Furthermore, I am pleased to hear about the service delivered by our front desk and will look into staffing for our lounge. We hope you enjoyed your stay and look forward to serve you once more during your next visit to the city of Fullerton.

Summary Heading: Wait for the renovations to complete; concierge lounge lacking
Summary: I stayed 1 night at this Marriott along with my coworkers.  One of my coworkers got the renovated room which was very nice.  I got the older room with the carpet and older bathroom.  I would suggest waiting or requesting for the renovated room.  Location:  Really close to Fullerton College just off the freeway.  Easy access. Parking - plenty of free parking for hotel guest just outside Internet - I have Marriott gold so high speed internet is free; however, I had to call for support because unable to connect to wifi initially.  After they reset the router, the connect was good.  If you don't have Marriott rewards, it's a $. Lobby - inviting and receiptionist was very helpful.  Got me checked right in. Concierge Louge - I got this because I'm a gold member; I've been to several
Manager Response: Travelpiggy,   Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback from your last stay. There is certainly quite a difference between our renovated rooms and our non-renovated rooms, and we are excited to have all the rooms completed soon. Shooting for the end of the year.   Thank you for the feedback on our Concierge Lounge as well, we have been looking for ways to improve our feedback and our guests' experience in that area as well. I will be sure to pass your thoughts along to to my Executive Chef.  Thank you!

Summary: I stayed at the hotel for three nights. When I check in the hotel, the reception desk staffs are all smiling. The hotel lobby is very clean. The room and bathroom are also very clean.  Since I was away during construction hours, I did not notice the construction. The hotel is very close to highway, which makes driving easy.

Summary Heading: Comfortable Marriott with good sized rooms
Summary: A nice Marriott with good sized rooms. Staff were very helpful and it had a good sized bar. I never tried the restaurant so can't really comment on the food but the breakfast selection in the M lounge was decent. The hotel is currently under renovation so a fair bit of noise audible in my room during the afternoon. However, the main reason I'm rating it 4/5 was because the shower was cold on 3 occasions. This may be linked to the renovations so I'd hope it wouldn't be an issue in future. I would be happy to stay there again.

I spent four days at this location for business.  When checking in I was informed that they did not have any "standard" rooms, but I could upgrade to the concierge level for an additional $30 per night.  Great, let's do that.  Only to find out that the concierge lounge was closed on all but the last day of my trip.  I had to beg for a restaurant breakfast voucher since they could not honor the concierge services.  One of the mornings the desk person informed me that I was not "qualified" under my rewards number to have concierge level services, and reluctantly gave me a voucher.   Like she was doing me a favor.  The renovation should have started with new elevators.  They are very slow and most of the days they were in use by the remodel staff.  Also, materials used in the
Manager Response: Dear larrymU7173QZ,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your previous stay. The comments in regards to the service caught my attention as it is unlike our staff. I assure you that your comments will be shared with our team in order to improve the overall experience for our guests. We are making great progress with our renovation and the elevators will be a point of focus once our rooms are completed. I'm pleased to hear that you enjoyed the selection and service from our restaurant. I will make sure to pass on the great words to our chef and staff. We hope that you have not lost faith in our hotel and give us a second opporutunity to better serve you during your next visit.

Summary: I just spent the past two weeks at the Marriott Fullerton on business.  The hotel is under renovation but the new rooms are incredible.  So modern and fresh looking.  They have a great restaurant, Spadra 33, that has a hidden courtyard with a large fire pit.  A perfect place to grab evening drinks with friends or co-workers.  Service is outstanding the hotel is very clean.  You won't be disappointed.

This was our first time at the Marriott and CSUF.  We had a room on the first floor that was not yet renovated.  It had a view of the parking garage.  Since this trip was mainly to move our daughter into the dorms, a view of the parking garage wall did not bother us.  Had breakfast at the buffet in the morning, it was just OK.  Service was very good but food nothing to write home about just normal breakfast fare.  Room was dated and had a very weird door set up, bathroom door and entry door would hit each other.  Hopefully with the renovations this will change.  However, room was clean.  Front desk service was excellent, friendly and helpful.  Since we had no view from our first floor room we spent some time out by the pool in the chairs.  It was nice, there was shade.  There

Summary Heading: The hotel is under renovation b/c it REALLY needs it
Summary: the hotel is quite dated and apparently the management knows it and renovating it. The room has the most ridiculous design with the doors. The main door and the bathroom door and the closet door kind of all open to the same place and as such, blocking  each other. You have to keep two of those closed to open the third one. It amazed me who came up with that kind of design at the first place. The room furnishing is also kind of getting old and needs a refresh.
Manager Response: Greetings realridge:  We are so very excited that our guestrooms are currently under renovation as we speak! During this time we will be completely redesigning the bathroom entry door with a modern barn door that will eliminate the issues that the doors currently have. The new design is both beautiful and functional! By October, we will have more than half of our rooms complete re-done! We look forward to offering our guests a brand new stay experience with us and we look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back to our hotel in the future!   Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: We stayed three nights and had both the updated and old room. The rooms on the 6th floor are updated and they are good. They are spacious and they look modern. Staff in the breakfast area are very friendly. The lobby is fully updated and looks great! Plenty of free parking is available at the property. About 30miles away from Los Angeles and takes a good 45min drive when it is not a rush hour. The location is good. You may want to wait until the renovation is fully completed(I believe in 6-8 months time) and then give it a try...
Manager Response: Greetings Sridhar T!  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent trip to Fullerton! I am so happy to hear you enjoyed our new guestrooms as much as we do! They are so beautiful and modern and perfect for our travelers! We anticipate being completed with renovations no later than the end of the year! I am glad you found our location convenient to Los Angeles, we cater to many guests that use LAX as their primary airport as well.  We look forward to continuing to be your hotel of choice! Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: Great staff and location, but this place is a dump!
Summary: I reserved a room with two beds, six weeks in advance, for three of us.  When we arrived, we were told the only rooms left were a king bed with a roll away, in the nonrenovated section.  All other hotels were booked so they had us by the short hairs.    Stepping out of the elevator is like a visit to the morgue, smells included.  The hall smells like dead things or sewer and the room like embalming fluid.  The chair in the room should be in a hotel room that gets rented by the hour, stains and hair, nice.  I spend many paragraphs describing how disgusting this part of the hotel is.    The staff was freindly and helpful but manager did not return two requests to contact me.    This has got to be one of the poorest managed properties I've experienced.  Fancy lobby and website but
Manager Response: Dear Tripping222:   I want to personally reach out to you to apologize for the issues that you described in your feedback during your recent stay with us. We pride ourselves on offering our guests a wonderful experience from start to finish and for your stay being anything less, I offer you my sincerest apologies. I am shocked to learn about the issues that you are describing and rest assured we take your feedback very seriously. Please know that I have shared your feedback directly with my executive committee so that we can ensure that these issues are reviewed and that appropriate action is taken.   It is my hope that you view the issues you described as isolated and that this personal note to you represents our true commitment to our guests satisfaction. We are very excited that we are currently going through a guestroom and corridor renovation with new rooms becoming available to our guests every few weeks. While we await the completion of our renovation, we are still 100% committed to ensuring our guests have a wonderful stay while with us and that we are offering the accommodations our guests should expect when choosing Marriott.   We hope to have the opportunity to host you again in the future at our hotel.   Sincerely,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: The location is undergoing a renovation, yet it was nice and accommodating. I'd be ok to stay at this location again. It's got lots good food near by and also close to the freeway. Thank you for a comfortable stay.
Manager Response: Greetings 572jacquelynns!  Thanks for giving us the opportunity to host you as our guest! We are so excited that we are undergoing our renovation currently and that you had a nice stay while with us! We focus each day on making our guest stay exceptional from start to finish, from the time that you check in, to your guestroom, eating in our restaurant and your departure from the hotel - you know that with us at the Fullerton Marriott we are here to make your stay special. Thank you for providing your feedback and we look forward to being your hotel of choice when traveling to Fullerton!  Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: August 2017: this property is currently undergoing a long overdue renovation.    PROs - lobby is completely renovated - thank goodness the rooms are started renovation. This property is LONG overdue for an update  CONs - wait until the rooms are done
Manager Response: Greetings 150hotelnightsayear:  Thank you so much for giving us an opportunity to host you as our guest for your recent travels to Fullerton. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our lobby space and if you loved that, you will absolutely love our renovated guestrooms! Currently we have our concierge floor that just completed the renovation and are available for guests to book. In addition, we will continue to have more rooms become available throughout the remainder of the year. We know our guests will absolutely love our new rooms and we can't wait to offer all of our guests an exceptional experience.   Thank you again for providing your feedback, we take feedback such as yours very seriously and utilize it as an opportunity to continually improve our services.   Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: This is not the best Marriott property I have stayed at. As a matter of fact it is quite an old property and you can tell by looking at the rooms. Felt like I am back to the 80's! However, the property is going under construction and the lobby has already got a new look. The rooms I believe were next to get the makeover...  I had visited the property in January 2017 on a business trip for 7 nights...  In terms of service, the hotel was quite good. It had an excellent breakfast spread and full service. It was raining during my stay and I did not use the pool, but it looked good...  Even though the rooms were small and felt cramped with 2 queen beds, I was able to sleep relatively comfortably and room service was kind enough to bring me a microwave to heat some food.   Also, there
Manager Response: Greetings Varun S:  I have some great news to share with you! We are currently in progress on our guestroom modernization and we will have new rooms available for our guests as early as mid-July! The rooms are progressing very nicely and as you mentioned, the lobby already looks great- I know that you will love the new guestrooms! They are an extension of the modern finishes in the lobby and will create a "stay as you live" experience so that our guests feel at home when with us. Thanks for providing your feedback and we look forward to host you as a guest in the future!  Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: I stayed at Marriott Fullerton during a business trip. It was picked do to its proximity to work and price. It's a decent hotel that offers all basic amenities at reasonable prices. The rooms are nothing special, they are a bit old but come with everything you'd expect from a hotel. Don't get fooled by its flashy lobby, this is not a luxury hotel. Still it's decent.
Manager Response: Greetings stric75! Thanks for choosing our hotel for your travels to the beautiful city of Fullerton! We are very excited that we are currently working on our guestroom renovation that will feature completely modernized guestrooms that we know our guests will love! The finishes that you see in the lobby, are carried through to the guestroom, so you can expect beautiful hard surface flooring, and light and airy colors throughout the room. We anticipate having our first wave of rooms completed and ready for guest use as early as mid-July! We can't wait to show them off!  Thanks again for your feedback!  Dianne General Manager

Summary: The hotel is very clean, with an exceptional staff. Since, it was graduation, the hotel was VERY BUSY!  However, the staff was always attentive to our needs and questions. They even had a special picture area set up for the graduates and family.  Very cool!    From the front office desk, to housekeeping, and the parking attendant everyone was very helpful.   Additionally, the rooms were clean and served our purpose.  The pool area was a lot of fun, as the weekend was hot!  The only concern, travelers need to be aware of the rates did go up due to the special event weekend.
Manager Response: Hi There Reitziger1!! Graduation weekend is one of our very favorite weekends of the entire year! We love to see all of the celebrations and the loved ones of our grads here to partake in the festivities! With many of our very own staff who are Titans we are proud to be the hotel of choice when coming for graduation or many of the other events held year round on campus! Thanks for your kind remarks on the staff, we know it is the people within an organization that make the difference, and when you love what you do, it's easy!  Thanks again for the great compliments! Best,  Dianne  General Manager

Summary: Arrived mid-afternoon and was greeted by an incredibly enthusiastic staff.   They certainly wanted to make sure that the room I received was what I was looking for and that I was aware of all of the services the hotel had to offer.   Certainly felt welcomed.  The facility was a little worn but all in all pretty well maintained.  Every time I left or returned I was greeted with recognition and enthusiasm.   Wow! Impressive.  Did not use the restaurant or bar but appeared to be well utilized.  Did use the Concierge Lounge – small and pretty tired.   Ready for an upgrade. Overall I would consider this to be a comfortable place to stay and would keep it on my list should I return to the area.
Manager Response: Salutations WI_Parrot!  WOW! What an amazing compliment to receive about the how wonderful your experience was with our staff! I am so delighted to read stories on how our team consistently went above and beyond the call of duty with their friendliness, and genuine, passionate hospitality! Thank you for taking the time to share that feedback with us!   We know that when our guests choose Marriott, they are choosing us because we offer a home away from home experience like no other. It is a responsibility that we accept with great enthusiasm (and I'm glad it shows!). It is our every day passion to make our guests feel comfortable and to exceed your expectations- and it sounds like we did a great job!  We are also very excited to say that we expect to debut our new guestrooms starting mid-July! The new rooms are a wonderful extension of the renovation we completed in our lobby, offering our guests a fresh, modern stay experience!   Thank you again for your feedback, and when your travels return you to Fullerton, we look forward to being your hotel of choice!  Best,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: it was a short day one nighter so i wouldn't have to drive all the way back home late, it was very pleasant & room was spacious, & very clean I was happy with the stay at Marriott. A night not to forget
Manager Response: Salutations Anna38_13! We're so happy to have been a comfortable spot for you to rest up for the evening and that you found the accommodations perfect for your needs! We are always committed to exceeding our guest's expectations and I am glad that we did it again!   Thank you for staying with us!  Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: Location is right off the Orange freeway (57) in Fullerton. It's right on the edge of the CSUF campus so for a campus visit it's great to walk right from the hotel to any building. The bar area is nice and service is great bar food was great. Pool area and fitness room are good for business travelers. Rooms are in the process of getting updated, I had an older room which was still decent but would have been nice to get an updated one. If you are staying in the near future, ask for a higher floor room because they started from the top floor.
Manager Response: Greetings Eric_abc! Thanks for your feedback on  your recent stay! We are so happy that you selected us for your stay. We love hearing from our guests about how much they enjoyed our proximity to campus! We are the perfect location for students, parents, and faculty alike! In addition, thanks for your nice comments on the bar and our restaurant! Our executive chef has carefully crafted the items on our menu that are sure to appease your taste buds! If you haven't done so already- next time try our new artichoke flatbread- one of my favorites!  We look forward to being your hotel of choice each time you return to our wonderful city! Best,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: Close to the freeway. Spacious rooms.  Don't be fooled by it being 30 miles from LAX.  The traffic is horrible and it'll take you at least an hour to get there.  More if it's rush hour.  This is a college town so take note.  About 45 mins to the city of Los Angeles.  This location is going through a renovation so the lobby is beautiful but the rooms are dated.  Pretty clean but average at best.  Parking is free but that's likely because it sucks. Deck is not connected to the hotel and there is no back entrance.  You will be walking across the lot around to almost near the front entrance to get in so drop off luggage at the front door before you park. Also there are no mini fridge and microwaves in the room.
Manager Response: Greetings Tracy D:  I am terribly sorry to learn about the time it took for you to arrive at the hotel from LA! That LA traffic is definitely no laughing matter and I am happy to hear that when you arrived, you found us conveniently located right off of the exit.  We can't even begin to explain how excited we are to be able to offer our guests our new guestroom package in the coming months- our guestrooms are an extension of the look and feel you experienced in the lobby- they will be absolutely perfect for our modern travelers! With regards to the parking, please let us know if we can ever assist with luggage, we are always here to assist to make your stay as effortless as possible and as for the refrigerator and microwave, although our rooms are not currently equipped with those items, we do have them available for request at no additional charge. On your next visit, please don't hesitate to let any of our staff members know to set that up for you.   As always, we are committed to exceeding the expectations of our guests and we look forward to the opportunity to host you in the future.   Best Wishes,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable room, useful location, with a few problems.
Summary: The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and the bed comfortable.  It's almost right on the CSU Fullerton campus, so very convenient if you have business there.  The fitness room is quite nice.  There were two problems: The bathroom door is hinged so that it closes automatically and cannot be kept open.  However, the bathroom has no fan in it.  So after you shower and steam up the mirror, there is no way to air the room out to clear it (for shaving, blow-drying your hair, etc.).  A bigger problem: the hotel runs out of hot water.  I couldn't get any until I ran it for a full 7 minutes (the desk clerk suggested I just "run it a long time"), and then it went completely cold when I had a head full of shampoo.  They need new water heaters!
Manager Response: Greetings Rachel C:  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I am very happy that you found many of our accommodations perfect and convenient to your needs. We pride ourselves on being a great place to stay for business and leisure when visiting the CSUF campus! I am very disappointed to learn of a few of the negative issues that you experienced. I do have great news! During our renovation, we are addressing the door issue to allow the door to remain open so that air can circulate into the restroom area. This will have a huge positive impact on the guestroom experience and we cannot wait for our guests to experience our new rooms once they become available! In regards to the hot water issue, please know that I will share your feedback directly with my Chief Engineer to review and resolve the issue. I do deeply apologize to you for this occurring.  It is my hope that you continue to trust Marriott Hotels wherever your travels may take you and that we would have the opportunity to host you again as our guest in the future.   Thank you again Rachel C for all of the feedback! Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed here for my wedding weekend and am commenting mostly on the outstanding service we received. We worked with Cara for the year leading up to the wedding and she could not have been more helpful, attentive, and accommodating to us. There was a huge convention in town that weekend, which she alerted us about immediately, and secured us 10 rooms and the bridal suite. We were so lucky to have these! They allowed other guests who wanted to stay here have our group rate if they were able to secure a room outside our block.  While they do talk up their remodel, the remodel is not complete (the lobby and restaurant are done and are excellent-especially the restaurant/bar)! The rooms are not yet updated, at least not the ones we stayed in. The rooms are basic and the
Manager Response: Greetings Emily B! First and foremost, CONGRATULATIONS on your marriage! We are so happy for you and your spouse and we thankful that we got to be a part of your special day! It truly makes the work we do worthwhile to be able to share in those wonderful and precious moments! We wish you both a lifetime of happiness!   I am so happy to learn that you had a great stay while with us and that my staff was able to overcome the issues that we were experiencing with the heavy rainfall and still make your wedding weekend great. Our team is very passionate about the work that they do and I am glad to hear that it shows!   In addition, we are very excited about our guestroom renovation! We can't wait to have our new rooms ready for our guests to use! We hope you consider our hotel for your one year anniversary!  Thank you Emily for all of your feedback, and we look forward to being a part of many more wonderful memories to come! Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: I'll start with the positives: the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Comp breakfast for gold members was good, especially the weekend option in the lobby. The location is excellent as it's right off the 57.  Negatives: the room was so dated. I understand that they've begun renovating rooms, but they are awful currently. The yellow striped wallpaper in the bathroom had spots missing. The bed faced the window instead of the tv, which made tv watching super awkward. I've never had such an odd hotel room configuration.   The worst was a fire alarm that went off, and the phone had a concierge button that went straight to a busy tone. What should have been a relaxing evening wound up incredibly annoying as my husband had to go all the way to the lobby to let them know that
Manager Response: Dear Joy_loves_traveling:   Thank you for providing feedback on your stay with us. I deeply apologize for the issue that you experienced with the sudden activation of your guestroom smoke detector. We strictly follow all local city regulations and thoroughly inspect our smoke detectors to ensure they are working properly and provide safe and comfortable accommodations for all of our guests. Again, please accept our apologies for any issue that occurred and rest assured we take all feedback very seriously as an effort to continually improve our services. We will also share your feedback with our associates directly so that we can better handle unexpected situations such as these moving forward.  With regards to our guestroom renovation- we truly cannot wait to start having rooms available for our guest's use! We know our guests are going to absolutely love the new guestroom with it's modern, yet comfortable touches. In addition, we understand that the TV and bed layout is somewhat awkward and we are pleased to announce that the issue is being corrected during the renovation! Great feedback!  Thank you again for the opportunity to address your feedback, it is our hope that you continue to trust Marriott hotels wherever your travels may take you and that we would have the opportunity to host you as our guest again in the future.   Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: FALL IN LOVE WITH CSU FULLERTON
Summary: 2/24-26  Stayed at the FULLERTON MARRIOTT, For Fall In Love with CSU Fullerton Potential Freshmen Event.   I'm a HILTON Honors member and typically go Embassy Suites for the Manager's Reception and Included Made-to-Order Breakfast for Family of 4.   Although the Marriott Concierge Level was closed Fri to Sun, I chose this location as the Brea ES was going through a remodel and this location was A Great Stay!! Across from CSU Fullerton Campus w/Complimentary Parking.  We Could walk right across the street to enjoy activities.  Our Stay was for Friday to Sunday. The Only Catch, we weren't arriving at a 'normal ' Check-in Time.   The Marriott App allowed for Easy On-Line Booking & Check-in with a Note to arrive 2am Sat morning.   Thursday, I contacted the Fullerton Marriott and
Manager Response: Greetings Wayne O!  Thanks so much for the wonderful feedback! I am delighted to know that you enjoyed our stay and that our staff played such a great role in making you and your family comfortable while with us! It's true- with our proximity to Cal State Fullerton- it makes it so incredibly easy to enjoy all that the college has to offer for those special family weekends and we are glad to hear that you found the walk easy to and from the campus! Thank you for the suggestion to work closely with the CSU Fall Orientation Planning Committee! I have shared your feedback with our team who will reach out to them to hopefully get more information about our partnerships with CSUF to the families of the students! We look forward to being your home away from home for the next couple years as your 'Titan' enjoys their time here on campus!   Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager CSUF Alumni

Summary: I was here only for a quick stop. WHat I noticed is that the lobby, the garden are very pleasant. The corridors, the room were dated -nothing ugly, just less fresh than the lobby. Nice people work here and you can bet on having a good stay.
Manager Response: Salutations Hedin!  Thank you so much for the feedback on your recent stay! It delights me to hear that you enjoyed our lobby and outdoor spaces! Less than two years ago, we completely remodeled our lobby space - it sure looks and feels modern and nice! We have also been working diligently on our outdoor space with our new pool furniture and landscaping! If you love the lobby- then you are definitely going to love the guestrooms once our guestroom renovation is complete! The rooms are a compliment to the finishes we have in the lobby, offering our guests a modern and comfortable stay experience. We look forward to continuing to host you as our guest when your travels return you to Fullerton!  Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: Great hotel and service.  Breakfast was awesome and service was great!! Great location and amenities.  I would recommend this to anyone needing to stay in the Fullerton area.  Many places to eat close to the hotel.
Manager Response: Hi There Darren M! A referral is always our greatest compliment! Thanks so much for writing that you would recommend our hotel to anyone coming to Fullerton! That truly means the world to us and we are very happy that you enjoyed your stay! I'm also excited to know that you enjoyed our staff! We know that it is truly the kindness of the people who operate an establishment that makes the difference! And starting the day off right with a good breakfast doesn't hurt either! Thanks again and we look forward to your return in the future!  Best Wishes,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: The highlights of my stay at Fullerton Marriott: - housekeeping kept my hotel room in tip-top shape for the entirety of my three-night stay, which says a lot about how a hotel is run. - I received great customer service, in particular from Dianne Floryan (GM), who treated me with professionalism and respect when I spoke with her about an issue with my nightly rate.   The outer facade of the hotel appears old, but there are renovations where it matters (gym, lobby, and room). I would say the one critical feedback I have for the hotel is the absence of a water dispenser in the lobby, for guests.
Manager Response: Greetings Tyrone V! I wanted to send you a quick note and say thanks for taking the time to post feedback on your stay with us! I am so happy we had the opportunity to chat during your stay with us! Also I have a great update to share- we took your advice and we have a water dispenser in the lobby now! Daily, we infuse the water with lemons and oranges for a little flavor and our guests love it! Thanks for the great suggestion!   Looking forward to welcoming you back in the future,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: Very Friendly Staff and some nice extras
Summary: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights on business and was very pleased with my stay. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable, but be warned there is no refrigerator. I asked for a quiet room and was placed in a room on the 4th floor, away from the elevators and on the inside overlooking the pool, and it was quiet. The restaurant menu offered a pretty limited selection but everything we had was delicious and the service was friendly and accommodating to the special receipts and split checks our business trip required.  Things that really stood out to me were:  1) the gym had a good number of well-maintained cardio machines (treadmills/elliptical/bikes)--thought not much weight equipment. They also had complimentary fresh fruit available. 2) We were given the option to NOT have our

Stayed for 1 night a couple days before Christmas. Front staff were friendly enough, but the room was small and tight. Assuming that because we paid via Priceline that we got the bargain-basement room. It was a first-floor room, with a tight, weird layout.   I'm not one into feng-shui, but the layout was definitely off. Walk in, small bath on the left, enter main room with headboard facing back toward the door. Clean enough but begging for an update. (Old, yellowing plastic switchplates, etc.)   Also, not that picky or sensitive about hotel beds, but this one was much too soft, with a definite "valley" in the middle that my husband & I had to avoid rolling into!   Overall it was OK for a 1-night stay in the area, served our purposes but nothing memorable.
Manager Response: Greetings KellyLS:  Thank you for choosing our hotel to spend a night during this holiday season! We are honored that you had selected us and appreciate your feedback. We are very excited to announce that we have started our guestroom renovation that will include a complete redesign of our guestrooms! Our new look is very modern-perfect for today's traveler! We hope that in the future should your travels return you to Fullerton, that we might have the opportunity to host you as our guest again.   Best Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: Great staff and a pleasant place to stay...
Summary: I stayed here on a work trip while visiting the Cal State Fullerton campus, and I loved our hotel. It was close to the university, which made for an easy walk to and from campus, as well as the athletic facilities. I was also able to access the freeway easily, and there were plenty of Ubers in the area to take me to closer stops.  The property's lobby and dining areas are updated and pleasant for a leisurely chat or meal, and we thoroughly enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet. The rooms have cute vintage Cal State decor with gameday posters and championship photos, and as always, the Marriott's complimentary bath products are second to none. I also loved the environmentally-friendly touch of the hotel then planting a tree as a token of appreciation for my choice to decline

I think I really just expected more from a Marriott. The lobby and common area were beautiful and employees at check in very good. But our room was on smaller size. Basic amenities, could not figure out thermostat, and window view was blocked by trees completely. Did sleep quite well on the bed though. Glad to hear they're remodeling. Would still recommend for area.
Manager Response: Dear ksjr2007,  Thank you for providing feedback from your previous stay. Based on your comments we missed on a few opportunities to enhance your stay. As you mentioned we will be renovating our rooms in the near future. Our staff is extremely excited about the process of upgrading our product and we hope that you can give us a second chance when your travels bring you back to Fullerton.

Summary: If it was not for wanting to see the UCLA Bruins play a very late night game on the road in a tournament I probably would never stayed. But if you find yourself visiting Fullerton and/or need to go Cal State there this is the place to stay. Staff is nice, rate was good, restaurant food OK.

This hotel is conveniently located with easy access to freeways and main roads (if you're like me and don't enjoy the freeway experience!) The hotel staff were professional and efficient. The rooms are clean, quiet and well appointed. The restaurant/lounge is open and inviting and the food delicious. The servers were also very helpful and attentive. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I have been traveling for about a month now and stayed across several Marriotts including a property in Bogota which was just incredible, so my expectation has been set too high. The hotel lobby looks like it's just been renovated and staff is friendly. I am on my 2nd night of a five-night stay and it's just been a big disappointment. I have silver status and it doesn't seem like there is any advantage. For example, in Bogota and Washington DC properties they had water bottles in the room that were complimentary. The Wi-Fi at other hotels included premium access, not here. The breakfast buffet is pretty basic and not very good. I ordered fried eggs well done and they came undercooked. The gym had rotten fruit. When I got back to room this evening the room was not made and stunk
Manager Response: Dear Jose M,  First and foremost I'd like to apologize for the issues you have experienced during your stay so far. We hope that we can turn your stay around and assist in any way possible. Your comments have been shared with the appropriate managers in order to prevent this from happening once again. Rest assure that we truly appreciate your loyalty to Marriott as a Silver elite member. I would be more than happy to honor the high speed internet access at no charge and add the access to the  concierge lounge for the remainder of your stay. These perks are a standard to our Gold and Platinum members of Marriott. Please stop by at our front desk and we would be more than happy to assist.  Best,  Henry Flores Front Office Manager

Summary: We have been long time Marriott owners and guests. This hotel lobby & the rooms have just been refurbished and I can't tell you how pleasant and helpful staff was. And it is right in the middle of downtown right in the middle of all the action just to walk to any restaurant, bar or shopping. Quite nice

Summary Heading: Not a typical Marriott, but nice enough
Summary: Odd place actually.  The pool area is well kept and wonderful.  The restaurant is right there when you walk in the door - seat yourself - food's ok, but not terrific.  Rooms are apparently going to be updated - there's a display of the "future" just off the lobby.  Hope they think about adding some electrical outlets,  To plug in a phone an ipad and a computer required using every accessible electrical outlet in the room!!  No electrical outlets by bed or bedside table - - only electrical outlet at desk requires crawling on your hands and knees.  If you can't find a blowdrier - it may be hanging in the closet behind the ironing board - not kidding.

Clean hotel with good fitness room.  Nice bar in lobby.  Breakfast is served in the AM buffet style and was good. The hotel is located conveniently with easy access to Fullerton/Anaheim.  Friendly employees.  Overall three stars.
Manager Response: Greetings Rob C!  Thank you very much for your kind feedback on your stay with us! We are pleased to hear that you had a pleasant time and we look forward to welcoming you back to the Fullerton Marriott when your travels return you to our beautiful city!  Our Best,  Dianne and the Fullerton Marriott Team  Dianne Floryan General Manager

Summary Heading: good location but needs to be updated !
Summary: Great location if you want to be close to the Anaheim / Fullerton area. The lobby has been renovated but the rest of the hotel really needs to be updated....I was a bit surprised when I walked out of the elevator on the 4th floor, it felt like I was in a motel or one of those unbranded hotels....definitely not up to Marriott standards ! rooms are small but adequate, bathrooms are ok. The carpet and chair had stains. The bathroom tub would not drain and I had to pull out the mess that was blocking it, this took a while and stressed me out cause I had to rush to the airport ! concierge lounge was ok. The staff is excellent, Joelle at check in was very helpful and so was Al, the parking attendant. I pointed out the tub drain issue to Henry at the front desk when checking out and I
Manager Response: Dear ALTX01,  Thank you for taking the time to provide constructive feedback on your previous stay. Our ultimate goal is to provide a memorable stay for our guests. I apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced and hope everything worked out well at the airport. Rest assure that the issue reported was taken care of by our maintenance staff. Furthermore, we will be undergoing a renovation this year in order to improve the condition of our lobby and rooms. A date has not been set at the moment but we will make sure to keep our guests updated with new information. We look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel in a quiet location
Summary: Stayed at the Marriott Cal State Fullerton for a quick trip to Southern Cal and was there for 1 night.  Checking in was one of the highlights.  Was greeted by Joelle who was attentive, efficient and  super hospitable. I stay at quite a few hotels and very rarely have a memorable check in experience.  That set the tone for my stay.  I had a quiet room towards the back of the hotel facing away from the freeway. It was over 90 degrees outside but the room temperature was great.  The rooms themselves were very efficient.  A comfortable king bed, a desk, complimentary coffee, all the standard features.  The bathroom looks newer and had a good assortment of toiletries. Overall it was a great property to stay at.  Got there on Saturday am and left on Sunday and it does seem that with

Clean, easy access from freeway! Nice accommodations and foreground! Great customer service.... the staff is friendly and helpful!! Would most definitely stay here again! I highly recommend this hotel!

Many hotels are plagued by issues that truly are accidental. Hotel staff cannot be expected to anticipate every negative situation, and the best hotels are defined by a staff that manages to both maintain the integrity of the business as well as care for the needs of their guests. This necessary attitude reflects down from the leadership, and unfortunately, this hotel staff does not have such leadership. A good hotel makes you feel like a guest. This hotel made me feel like an enemy and a nuisance. In fact, their shadiness in response to me makes me wonder how many other guests they have taken advantage of in this way. I urge you not to stay at this hotel because the staff is not trustworthy.  Last weekend, my mother was getting remarried, and my sister, an employee of Marriott,

This location fit the bill for a good business trip.  All the services and people were helpful.  I was relaxed.  The lobby bar was nice as the servers were prompt, stopped by on a regular basis, but were not pests.  I appreciated it.

The lobby and grounds are updated and very nice, the staff are helpful and polite. The rooms are in desperate need of an update /remodel. The rooms do not match the rest of the hotel, they look dingy and old. The surrounding area is very nice with lots of great places to eat. Overall, I would stay here again only if it was a great deal.
Manager Response: Dear Dalezava,  Thank you for commenting on your past stay at our property. I'm extremely pleased to hear the positive feedback with our staff. Our team is always looking to improve in every aspect. With that in mind, our property will be undergoing a renovation this year. The update will include remodeling our rooms and hallways. We are beyond excited to begin the next phase at our hotel and we hope that you can join us once it has been completed.

Summary: The hotel is at a walking distance to any CSUF place. The room is big, clean and quiet. Wi-Fi is very good. The facilities are good too. The front desk people are very polite. The breakfast is not included and is charged on your bill.

Was here for a couple nights for business. The phrase "university hotel" often gives me cause for concern, but this was a good-quality Marriott. Staff, food, and location all above average - I wandered away from campus on a long run and was quickly able to find a footpath that went into the park and looped around the hills. The room was becoming threadbare, but a display in the lobby made it clear that they are about to renovate and update all the rooms. But even then, the rooms were clean and comfortable. Would stay here again without hesitation.

stayed for small business conference. Normally a Hilton guy so keep that in mind but this hotel was very convenient to John Wayne Airport.  Clean nice rooms and very quiet.  Definitely unique location basically on campus of Ca St but really did not notice.  The breakfast buffet is a little pricey but very good

I have not stayed here in a long time and so glad I came back.  The hotel is so nice and I was treated so great in the Executive lounge.  Shirley was there both nights I stayed and was a delight with some of the best service I've had in a long time.  She remembered me from the first night,  I will stay here every time I am in the area!  This hotel is a great value.

The hotel is okay.  The entry area and pool are very nice, the rooms seem old. The delight was the bar, Spadra33, and the bar tenders!  Generous pours, excellent mixes and a special new drink that Steve created. If you stay at this hotel be sure to  visit the bar and ask for Steve's new drink.

Beautiful hotel, very friendly staff! I a lways  stay here when I travel to Orange County/ Fullerton. Easy access to everything! Doesn't  matter if you are by yourself or with a group of people the staff treats you with kindness and respect.The grounds are beautiful  and the pool is relaxing.

Stayed in room 153. The room faced a grass courtyard, very quite. Bed was comfortable, room was spacious, but showing wear. Pool area was clean and well maintained. Fitness center clean and has updated equipment. Hotels restaurant has a good selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again for my business travel.

Summary Heading: For the location it worked well for us
Summary: I'm giving 4 out of 5 based more on lack of competition for this level directly in the area.  If i was giving a rating based only on the hotel it would be 3 or 3.5 out of 5.  For what we needed to do during our recent stay the Fullerton Marriott was extremely well located allowing us to stop by several times a day.  The free self-parking is a plus.  During our stay it was not so busy so we could park around the hotel and not need to access the connected parking structure.  The exterior grounds are taken care of nicely, the architecture of the exterior won't excite you but they have done a very nice job with the lobby and lounge areas, very modern contemporary.  Plenty of seating is available.  We had an accessible room on the concierge level, the 6th (highest floor).  The room

Attended a family reunion nearby and we took two rooms at this hotel.  Although the phone did not work in one room (first floor) we all enjoyed the classy lobby, great beds and fluffy pillows.  Perfect location for graduation ceremonies at CSF and other events in the Fullerton area.

Have stayed multiple times at this hotel.  The hotel is very conveniently located and also is reasonably priced considering its Marriot status.  Although, it is not next to Disney.   Hotel provides concierge service to Gold members, that is plus, but options are extremely limited.  Rooms are nice and clean and service is good. Overall, its a good hotel.

Summary Heading: Incredible renovation of lobby, restaurant and front desk
Summary: I couldn't believe this was the same hotel.  The renovation is beautiful.  Not many full-service hotels in Orange County with free parking.  Great location next to CSUF.  Nice selection for food within 10 minutes of hotel. About 10-15 minutes to Disneyland or Angels Stadium.  Concierge level is nice. Fitness center is small, but has everything you need for a good workout.  I will be back!

Summary Heading: Not your usual Marriott- must be part of a REIT
Summary: Not much investment in this Hotel - popcorn ceilings, lousy pool, old furniture.  OK staff of Cal St students - Management not visible.  Slow Bar and Restaurant Service with mixed results for food over two nights - overall not good.  Management did not plan for graduation well - no extra staff or hours - no warning to people staying there that an exit is closed and it takes 30 minutes to get out of parking lot - I tried to help by working with cops but management pathetic.  Great Internet and Free water downstairs nice.  House Keepers excellent.
Manager Response: Dear DubHub:   I am very saddened to learn of the multiple negative experiences that you had during your recent stay with us. Feedback is very important to us as we continually review our guest comments to ensure that we are always doing everything we can to make each guest stay special. I would love to speak with you more regarding the issues you had, and receive the necessary details to investigate the issues with service you experienced. As always, we are fully committed to addressing all guest complaints we receive promptly. When you have an opportunity, please reach out to me directly at dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com.   Thank you and I look forward to the opportunity to hear from you,  Regards,  Dianne F.  General Manager dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com

Summary: I traveled out for business and stayed at this hotel.  The staff is so nice.  The rooms are clean and the beds are very comfy. The breakfast buffet is very nice.  This hotel is convenient to the highway and it is close to everything I needed.   Love this hotel.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Friendly People, Loved It
Summary: Stayed at the Fullerton Marriott about a week ago with a colleague, doing some business in the area, and I heard this was a great business hotel.  I always enjoy meeting the people that work in the hotels I stay in, and I met a Nicole on this trip that was absolutely fantastic.  She knew the area, and directed me to some good eats.  She was always really pleasant, and super professional... but not in that fake 'I hate my job, but they pay me to smile' kind of way.  The room was cozy, quiet, didn't have any problems while I was here.  The bartenders were really friendly, and the food was really good.  Super happy that we picked this hotel, and I will definitely be back if I'm ever in Fullerton again.  Thank you Marriott Fullerton staff!!!

Summary Heading: Great Staff but issues with Room
Summary: I heard this hotel went through recent renovations and I liked the fact it was close to the location I was visiting.  When you walk in, the hotel lobby is beautiful.  The staff is extremely friendly and offered bottled water a check in.   The rooms were not so nice.  My bathroom had wallpaper literally peeling off the walls, the wood furniture was dented and evening missing pieces.  I can overlook cosmetic issues, as long as the room is clean.  Well, upon appearance it was clean however the previous guest left something in the bathroom that housekeeping overlooked.  I notified the front desk, they were embarrassed and extremely apologetic.  They handled it promptly and to my satisfaction.  I understand things happen and I hope they correct the issues with housekeeping to ensure

Summary Heading: Loyalist and I say don't bother staying here
Summary: First, let me tell you I respect the Marriott chain and I'm loyal to the brand but this hotel makes me seriously doubt my loyalty .  Not all Marriotts are equal.  The lobby gives you high hopes only to be completely disappointed / disgusted by the rooms.    Hallways remind me of a mid - 80's Sheraton.  Need painting.  Every door frame is scratched and chipping.  Patches in the wall paper.  If you can't maintain light yellow walls chose another color in the Marriott palette.  During my stay the 5th floor had an industrial blower in the hallway trying to dry the carpet from some leak.  Feel sorry for rooms nearby.    Rooms dark & dirty.  Again patched dents in the door.  Light switches had so much dirt I wouldn't touch them. Rusted screws holding it to the wall. (See photo) C'mon
Manager Response: Dear Mic_sully_y:  Thank you so much for providing feedback on your stay with us. I am truly saddened to learn of your negative experience. We deeply care about providing our guests with a top-notch stay, and when we have fallen short, it truly devastates us. We are committed to resolving issues promptly and to our guests satisfaction. I would love the opportunity to speak with you more regarding the issues that you experienced. Please contact me at your convenience at dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com.   Thank you again, and I look forward to the opportunity to speak with you,  Regards,  Dianne General Manager dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com

Summary Heading: Grounds and lobby are nice - the rooms not so much.
Summary: I spent the night here recently on a trip to the Cal Fullerton campus. On the positive side, you couldn't be much closer to the campus.  We just walked right onto campus.  The staff were all really nice and helpful.  The lobby and grounds of the hotel were very nice and well-maintained.  I think that was why I was particularly disappointed in the room.  It was pretty clean but definitely had some wear and tear on the furniture and paint was missing in spots especially in the bathroom.  The carpet was worn.  Time for an update on the rooms!  I might stay here again because of the convenience but again, I might not.  No breakfast either - but the wifi seemed fine.
Manager Response: Salutations Karen G! Thank you for choosing the Marriott Fullerton for your travels to Fullerton California! Thank you for your kind remarks regarding your interactions with our staff! We know that one of the most important things that makes a difference are the people that work in a hotel. We are lucky to work with such a wonderful group of hospitality professionals that truly care about our guests.   Next time you are in town, please do not hesitate to ask one of our staff members for a tour of our model room that showcases our upcoming guestroom renovation! Our new look is modern and comfortable, I know you will be totally impressed!   We look forward to continuing to me your hotel of choice when traveling to the area! Thanks again,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: Front desk was very friendly...answered questions regarding CSU Fullerton and gave us directions to downtown Disney.  Our room was nice and clean, and very spacious.  My only complain is they only offer 2 double beds, we really wanted 2 queen beds.  But I would definitely recommend and stay again!
Manager Response: Greetings Lorena A! Thanks for your feedback on your recent stay! I am glad that you found our location convenient to the CSUF Campus! Being right across the street really makes you feel as though you are a part of the campus! We are proud to be strong partners with our favorite university!   Looking forward to having you stay again with us in the future! Best,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: Great lobby; great staff; rooms need to be updated
Summary: This hotel has a great location on the campus of Cal State Fullerton and a staff that is very helpful and friendly.  The lobby and eating area look great - modern and well-maintained.  The rooms, however, were old and dated.  With that said, the hotel is in the process of upgrading the rooms.  They have a display showing how the rooms will look when the are finished.  I'm not sure when that will be, but if it matches the lobby, it will be great.  Even with the rooms in need of some updating, it was comfortable and provided easy access to the Cal State Fullerton softball and baseball facilities.  It is also close to a lot of places to eat.  If the rooms were more up-to-date, like other Marriott's I have stayed at, my review would have been higher.  However, I would still stay at
Manager Response: Many Thanks Austin D!   We appreciate you providing feedback on your recent stay with us and I am delighted to hear that you love our recently renovated lobby! I hope you had the opportunity to try out our new restaurant spadra33 located within the Greatroom as well that features our redesigned food and beverage options!   Our guestroom renovation will feature a new modern look, much like the other Marriott's you have stayed at, and will be a nice reflection of what you see in our lobby. We know our guests are going to love our new look and we cannot wait to show it off! Thank you for your kind review and we look forward to being your hotel of choice when traveling to the area.   All our best,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: Solid but needs to be refreshed
Summary: I've been staying in this hotel for business since around 2004 and the hotel needs to be updated - the hallways look dated. I really miss the omelet bar for breakfast which no longer exists. Now it's just a breakfast buffet.  There were about 10 associates from my company also there during my visit and about 8 of them reported issues connecting to the internet (wifi connects but it never comes to the screen where you enter your last name and room number). The front desk was happy to connect us with IT Support in Wisconsin who individually resolved each person but if we are all having the same issue, they should be working to get to root cause and resolve it.
Manager Response: Greetings Deepstops! WOW! Thank you so much for your loyalty for over 12 years! There is nothing more complimentary than a returning and loyal guest. Thank you for your continued trust in our hotel for all your travel needs in the city of Fullerton! I have GREAT NEWS to share! We will undergoing renovation this summer and completely redoing all of our hallways and guestrooms! The new look is extremely modern and I can't wait for you to see it! Also, I will look into the issues you experienced with our internet, rest assured I will speak with our provider to resolve that issue! Staying connected should be simple and we will work to make sure that it is!  Thank you again, your feedback is valuable to us. We look forward to your next stay! Regards,  Dianne  General Manager

Summary Heading: Best hotel next door to CSU !
Summary: Greatly convenient to CSU Fullerton to visit our son!  Friendly & efficient staff!  Being dog-friendly was a huge plus!  Rooms a bit small, but very comfortable.  Nice bedding. Rooms should have refrigerators & microwaves, without extra charge!
Manager Response: Hi There reablondebomb46! Let's Go TITANS! I am so happy to hear that you found our location convenient for you when visiting your son! We are proud to be a supporter of the campus and we are glad that we had you as our guest! Thank you for the compliments on our bedding as well! We pride ourselves on offering our guests a comfortable stay while with us and I am glad that this stay was no exception!  We currently do not have refrigerators or microwaves standard in our guestroom, but do have them available upon request free of charge.   I am interested in getting more details from you if you were ever informed that there was a charge for these request items. If you would be so kind, please contact me directly at dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com so that we may discuss this further I would truly appreciate it.   Thank you again for staying with us and I look forward to the opportunity to hear from you!   Regards,  Dianne  General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, just a little shy of great
Summary: Overall good stay at the Marriott Fullerton. Very friendly staff, nice clean Lobby and Restaurant. Rooms were clean well stocked. I did not make it to the gym myself but other guests I stayed with mentioned some sort of sewer smell in that area.  I would recommend requesting a room away from the highway as the windows do little to block out the noise. I'm not a light sleeper, but I still found myself waking up regularly when a louder vehicles would drive by.  Things to know, getting out of the hotel can be tricky in the morning, it's busy and not well situated in relation to the intersection, so give yourself an extra 10 minutes to make your daring escape. Bed was okay, but a little on the soft side for my liking.  The hotel above the main floor is borderline dated, it could
Manager Response: Greetings Whereareyougoing2016!!! Thanks for choosing the Marriott Fullerton for your stay in our beautiful city! We were delighted to have you as our guest! I have great news to share! Later this year we will be undergoing our guestroom renovation that will bring our guests a completely new and modern stay experience! Next time you are in town, we would be happy to show you our model room! You will love it!   We look forward to continuing to host you as our guest in the future! Best,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: If you're staying in this area, there's really only two choices, here and Embassy Suites in Brea.  Both are modern basic options.  This Marriott is ideal if you have any dealings with CSU.  The front desk works very well. Its operations are enhanced but their recent updated lobby.  They've gain a more upscale food and beverage area but lost their free coffee service in the morning.  The pool area remains clean and adequate for most families.  Although at times it can be used as a smoking lounge.  The gym is also small but adequate for quick workouts.  The rooms have not been updated.  They can be old, stained, and musty....or perfumed to hide the musty smell.  Dark carpets do a good job to hide the age of the rooms.  Housekeeping is clearly tired and forgetful, as is their
Manager Response: Greetings Thomasleemd!  We are so excited to announce that we will be beginning our guestroom renovation later this year! We know that our guests are looking for a new stay experience and we can't wait to deliver! Summary Heading: Nice lobby - rooms and concierge not great
Summary: At first arrival, this seems like a nice Marriott. The lobby is very nice. The rooms are old and dated. They have a worn out look, feel and smell. The concierge is very small, worn out too. The gym is fine. Nothing exciting. The outdoor pool is a nice option. Parking is free. The breakfast was quite good. Location is excellent. If you can deal with a shabby smelly room then this is a great Marriott.
Manager Response: Greetings travelsforworkBoston:   Thank you for trusting the Marriott Fullerton for your stay in the beautiful city of Fullerton. I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed our location along with our pool and breakfast.   I am very excited to say that we will be completing a guestroom renovation later this year. You will love our new look and we can't wait to show it off!   We look forward to continuing to host you in the future and look forward to offering you a new guestroom coming soon!  Sincerely,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: I am a business traveler, however at USD$5.00 for 5 minutes on the computer and $!.00 per page they are overpricing a simple and relatively cheap service - disappointing.  Breakfast was good and reasonably priced.  Location is good and the rooms were not ad.

Summary: I stay at Marriott hotels almost exclusively and this location is in desperate need of a renovation. The lobby seems to have been upgraded not that long ago, but the elevators, hall ways and rooms themselves were old and outdated. The lobby bar was decent enough and the food was good. On the plus side, the staff were all very friendly and the service was very good.
Manager Response: Greetings Thomas S.   Thank you very much for your loyalty to Marriott Hotels!
