We know our guests will absolutely love our new look! The next time you are in town, please don't hesitate to ask our staff for a tour of our model room!  If I can ever do anything for you, please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly and we look forward to hosting you as our guest in the future.   Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: Very nice open, well-decorated lobby with adjoining buffet room, comfortable seating and televisions to keep an eye on sports.  Comfortable beds with clean, crisp rooms.  Nice pool and hot tub with good seating.  Decent fitness center with variety.  Every employee I came in contact with, at least 8, was cheerful, pleasant, gracious and accommodating.  They are well-trained.  Buffet was decent and reasonably priced. Nice free parking, too.
Manager Response: Good Day William M!   Thank you so much for your kind words! We are so grateful for the opportunity to host you as our guest! We look forward to being your hotel of choice when your travels return you to our beautiful city!   Best,  Dianne

Summary Heading: Average business hotel at a great location near Cal State Fullerton
Summary: This hotel is located on the 57 freeway just off Nutwood, literally right next to Cal State Fullerton.  The lobby area looks chic and modern. I really like the seating area where people can hang out and have a drink. I really like the energy I saw tonight. People were having a good time.   I used mobile check-in and promptly received notification that my key is ready to pick up. The front desk lady who gave me my key was very efficient but lack personal skills. She was the only employee I encountered during this stay and didn't project a friendly and approachable impression.   Free Parking was challenging at 9pm and it took a long while for my guests to park and visit.   The rooms are a little dated. I was assigned a back of the hotel room facing the pool. It is a better view
Manager Response: Greetings Marcus M:   Thank you for providing feedback on your stay with us. Our lobby has been recently renovated -  we are glad you love the look as much as we do! I am sorry to hear that our staff member at check in delivered anything less than exceptional service to you. We pride ourselves on our guest service and for anything less, I truly apologize to you. In addition, I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the pool view room- it really is a great view! Thank you again for providing feedback on your stay with us, and we look forward to opportunity to hear back from you and to host you as our guest in the future.   Best,  Dianne  General Manager

Summary Heading: Bed Bugs. Lots of Bed Bugs
Summary: I visited this Marriott on business in October 2014. More on why I am writing this review now in a bit. Apparently, my room was loaded with them. I went to my meeting and began to itch. Really, really bad. Had welts on my arms, neck and legs. I alerted the front desk and they wished me away from the front desk so others could not hear. They said corporate would contact me for compensation and any cleaning of my clothes, etc.  I got home and had to go to Urgent Care because of my sever reaction to the bites. I was put on antibiotics and anti inflamitories.   Corporate did contact me and put me in contact with their insurer, Zurich. The person who was handling my case said they would reimburse me for my medical expenses. I filled out all of the paperwork and said they would get

Thank you for raising your concerns regarding your incident at our hotel in October of 2014 and for taking the time to speak about your issue over the phone with me. We are committed to resolving guest issues quickly. Unfortunately many industries are effected by these sorts of issues, and I apologize for your stay being impacted by this. Please rest assured that following the incident occurring at the hotel, the management staff took immediate action to resolve this issue and to prevent it from occurring again in the future.   I look forward to continuing to work with you with regards to this issue and if there is anything that I can do, please do not hesitate to continue to utilize me as a point of contact.   Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but I couldn't stay there...
Summary: Was in Fullerton on business with two colleagues. After driving from LAX, was looking forward to crashing in my room. Problem is, there was an "incident" earlier in the day and mine was one of three rooms that had reservations cancelled. In fairness, I will say that the hotel graciously picked up the tab for a room at the Holiday Inn across the street - though I didn't want to stay there.  Had two meals in the property since my colleagues didn't lose their rooms; both dinner and breakfast were very good.
Manager Response: Dear JPKGTA,  Thank you for taking the time to comment on your past experience. I apologize for any inconvenience you endured as our team had to relocate your reservation. Unfortunately we had an unexpected incident that occurred which caused us to remove rooms from inventory. I'm pleased to hear that you enjoyed both dinner and breakfast at our property. We hope that you give us a second opportunity to better serve you during your next travels to Fullerton.

Summary: Not a bad hotel.staff members Sasha and I think her name was Nicole at the front desk are absolutely awesome. Very helpful, friendly and have a great attitude.  My room was a decent size room, the bed was great and pillows were very comfortable.  Big lobby sitting area and a bar. (Didn't try the bar) lots of food options within walking distance. I walked to other side of freeway and found a gem of a restaurant,  Pepe's Mexican food. Omg! Awesome! (As seen on food network) Anyway this hotel had a breakfast that was decent. The previous 2 nights I stayed at another Marriott in another location about an hour away, so at Breakfast I was missing the omelette station and waffles. So I had to lower my review score because of breakfast. Other than that everything else was great. Loved

Thank you for the positive feedback and we look forward to seeing you again soon!  Thank you so much,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: I had to make a quick trip to southern California and chose to stay at the Marriott Fullerton.  I've always had great accommodations at Marriott.  This particular one was extremely disappointing.  Wallpaper in bathroom was peeling off, paint was scuffed, room had a funky long hallway entrance.  Staff was nice and parking was okay. Just not what I am used to seeing at a Marriott.
Manager Response: Dear Ken S,  Thank you for taking the time to comment on your previous stay at the Fullerton Marriott. I sincerely apologize for the condition of the room you were placed in. Please note that our hotel will be undergoing a renovation in our room and hallways this year. We are confident that our rooms will be a product that our loyal guests are accustomed to when travelling to a Marriott. We hope to get a second opportunity to serve as your choice of stay when visiting the city of Fullerton.

Summary: We've stayed many times at this hotel since our daughter attends Cal State Fullerton.  It's a basic hotel.  Some rooms are cleaner than others, some better maintained.  I like the corner rooms but don't always get them.  Air conditioners are old and noisy and keep you up all night.  What I don't like is they don't give any preference or greeting to Marriott reward customers.  Don't know why that's not standard across country.  One night they gave our double bed room away so four of us had to squeeze into a king and roll away.  The manager the next morning moved us and gave us free breakfast for remainder of stay.  While the manager was professional and accomodating the night person could care less to accomodate us after a 7 hour drive.     Now they have renovated lobby and
Manager Response: Greetings Liz125:  Thank you for providing feedback on your stay with us! I am very sorry to learn of the negative experience that you had while with us. In addition, we will continue to utilize all of your feedback to continue to improve our services.   Thank you again, and if you would like to discuss your concerns further, please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly at dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com.  My Best,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: This hotel is truly in need of renovation.    Bedroom: very tired and outdated, not your typical Marriott room.  Dingy room, damp sofa, limited power outlets.  No closet, but hanger.  Bathroom: cleanliness could be improved.  I lost my contact lens as the faucet stopper didn't close properly.    Buffet breakfast: ready made.  Charging extra for fried egg.
Manager Response: Greetings LaTravgirl,  Thank you for providing feedback on your stay with us. We take feedback to heart, and are truly devastated when our guests have anything less than an exceptional stay. In addition, I am pleased to announce that later this year, we will be undergoing a guestroom renovation. We know our guests will love the new look!   If you ever need anything or would like to discuss your concerns further, please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly at dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com  Regards,  Dianne General Manager

Summary: This Marriott is one of the best.  The room (suite) we had was exceptional with a separate bedroom and a large living area to relax in.  The breakfast buffet was diverse enough that we all found something to eat.  The staff from the front desk to the breakfast waitstaff was extremely friendly and helpful with any request.    The Marriott is located in at the California State University but is very near an assortment of shopping and dining options.  It is only about a 15 minute drive to the Disney parks and a much better value for your stay than those hotels right by the park. We look forward to visiting this Marriott again.

I stayed at this same hotel the same days over the Christmas holiday there were lots of notices that the hotel was going through renovation.  Unfortunately, this didn't mean the rooms, which badly need an upgrade.  You can't find a plug for any devices without moving furniture, getting on your hands and knees, and using wall sockets.  The beds are very comfortable, and that's the only saving grace of the room. In terms of this visit, it was very sub-par, not what you hope for over the holidays.  Though I checked in at 4:30pm, and it appeared the maid was done with the room, shampoos and soaps open and half-used were in my shower.  Long black hairs were on the toilet paper, and the quality of the paper is something you'd expense in a budget hotel. The remote for the television is

Rest assure that your comments have been shared with the appropriate managers. I hope that you can give us a second opportunity to make it right when you next visit the city of Fullerton.

Summary Heading: In need of a major overhaul
Summary: At first when you enter the lobby and restaurant appear to be recently remodeled.   Then you step off the elevators into a 70's decor and the rooms are very dated.   The concierge lounge might as well not be there as the offering is very limited.   This property seems to suffer in the service department in several areas that I observed.   My rooms tub had not been cleaned properly from the previous guests, iron was broke and the bathroom sink would not drain. I did bring these to the desks attention and two of the three were corrected. For some unknown reason they left the broken iron in the room for the remainder of my stay. On returning to my room it had been on all day and gave the room a nice burnt aroma.   In the restaurant/bar good luck getting consistent service. They

I am sorry to hear that the service that you experienced was anything less than exceptional, as often we are complimented on our service and pride ourselves as such. Summary: I was amazed when we walked into the Lobby, they had completely remodeled this area, and it is beautiful.  They even have a lovely outdoor lounge area.  However the rooms have not, this is scheduled for the Spring of 2016 and it is needed .  As we are Gold customers, I was not impressed with the free buffet breakfast.  I have had much better at Fairfield and Springhill Inn.  They need to improve, it is not what I expect from a Marriott.  I have had much better at other Marriott's. I do want to say, the staff is very friendly, and our room was very clean.

We hope that you were able to view our "show room" that gives an example of what's to come. I'd be more than happy to answer any further questions or comments that  you may have. Happy Holidays!

Summary: Stayed here for business at CSU. Check in was smooth and pleasant. Room was clean and bed comfortable. Flat screen TV and wifi was decent (and free). My only complaint is that there was no plug near the work desk to plug in my computer. Also, the bathroom door does not stay open, which can make it really hot and steamy after showering. Breakfast buffet was $11.88 and was decent.

Upgrades coming- but wait for upgrades. Thinking this was a full service Marriott - you would expect a full service Marriott as far as rooms and quality. People very friendly and helpful but that's all I can say about this hotel. Rooms in need of serious upgrades. Instead of pointing out all I did not like- I will just advise you to ask if upgrades are finished in 2016 before you book.
Manager Response: Dear bernylloyd,  Thank you for taking the time to comment on your previous stay and providing feedback on areas of improvement. We are pleased to hear that our staff was able to assist with any accommodations you requested in a courteous manner. Furthermore, I would like to inform you about our future plans. Our team is fully aware of the condition of our property which is why we are extremely excited to announce the renovation that will occur in the beginning of the new year. A date has not been set quiet yet but we are allowing guest to view our "show room" as an example of what we are anticipating. Thank you once again for your comments and we hope to serve as your choice of stay when visiting the Orange County area.

Summary: This hotel is located right opposite CSUF. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast buffet is good. The lobby has a modern and trendy look. Being in the university area, there are restaurants and shops within 2-3 blocks of walking.   Only drawback, they didn't have a complimentary shuttle drop-off and pick-up even though my office was about 4 miles. I have had this service in other Marriott and hence was a tad disappointed.

The room was clean and very comfortable.  Loved their soap, shampoo and conditioners.  Liked having infused water available in the lobby and warm cookies in the evening.  Near Disneyland and other attractions, as well as restaurants including one on site.  Very accommodating, and the staff gets an A+ from me.  Had a specific space for the ironing board with a convenient outlet in it.  Can be difficult getting into the parking area, if you miss your turn off.

This hotel is in a convenient location and the staff is very cordial and accommodating.  However, the rooms are rather small and the furniture inconveniently arranged, and lack sufficient connections for laptops and phones. Like many Marriott hotels, there is a decided lack of towel racks/hooks in the bathroom.  The buffet breakfast, priced at $11.95 PP, is quite good with ample selections and attentive and prompt wait staff.  You can also order from the menu if you prefer.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel!  Really enjoyed our time here!
Summary: We were impressed with the beautiful, modern lobby and were told upon our arrival that it had just been renovated.  Nice job, Marriott!  Our room looked down on the pool and it was also fun to watch the college students scurry to classes as this property is directly adjacent to Cal State Fullerton.  Our room was spacious and nicely appointed. As it was a warm afternoon when we arrived we enjoyed relaxing by the pool and the surrounding green area that was quite lush with plantings.  There was also a nearby gazebo that appeared to be used for weddings.  The front desk staff were super friendly and nice, and later in the afternoon they really went out of their way to help us find exactly what we wanted in the way of a restaurant for dinner, even going so far as to call and make a

Summary Heading: Half renovated so has teething issues
Summary: All three stars this hotel gets is because of location. Its located on Fullerton's campus so if you're visiting a friend here, this is where you should stay if you do not want to walk. When you first arrive, the lobby might fool you since the lobby is newly renovated. However, the rooms are old and you can tell by the old musky smell inside as well as the decor that was probably chic in the late 80s. My room was clean, but the bathroom was not. The tub had what was certainly shaving residue from the prior guest and there were long hairs in the tub too. As I have short hair, I knew this couldn't have come from me. Also, in my room , there was one outlet situated close to floor level in an inconvenient spot (comparable hotels generally have more convenient outlets). There were

Summary: We were looking for a reasonable priced hotel for one night but with a little more upgraded comforts and conveniences as compared to a typical budget hotel.  This hotel fit the items on our list. Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the pool.  The room was smaller in size but had a comfortable bed in a quiet area of the hotel.  Check in went smoothly, parking is free, cookies/fruit/lemon water at front desk, bathroom was big and clean.  No complaints.

The price was right and the locations was eight minutes from where I had to be.  The room was very old-school and some could find it off-putting.  I happen to have a thing for 60s and 70s California suburban mid-rise architecture, so it was all good for me.  The room has modern beds and desks.  I actually thought the art work was tasteful and meaningful.  Can you believe that?  Hotel art that is worth looking at?

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but rooms need remodeling
Summary: Stayed here two nights and overall the hotel was nice but the rooms and hallways seemed a bit dated - I felt like I was visiting in the 1960's.  Looks like the lobby had just been remodeled it had a clean modern look.  The room was a bit cramped and I was on the freeway side and could hear the traffic noise.  The bed however was very comfortable and I slept great.  The wifi was great - strong signal and very fast.  It was nice to have a paper delivered to the door in the morning.    The concierge room was very basic - small with limited options.     The gym was nice and there is plenty of parking in the parking structure.  The restaurant was also nice, with good food, fast service and reasonably priced.   Pool area was also very nice.  The hotel has a good location, right off

Our renovation will include all the newest bells and whistles that Marriott has to offer! We can't wait to share our new look with our guests! Regards,  Dianne Floryan General Manager dfloryan@marriottfullerton.com

Summary: We have stayed there many times in the past on our trips to Southern California.  The weekends rates seem to be very reasonable, since it is located on a college campus.  Most business there is M-F.  On this particular weekend, my high school was having our 40th reunion there and it was a win-win for us.   We had a group rate which was better than any other rate I could get.  The hotel is getting renovated and the lobby/restaurant area is so much more inviting.  Before, it was more compartmentalized and dark.  Now, all of it is connected and is bright/airy.  Although the have food available throughout the day, the actual bar is open from about 3:00PM on.  The Check-in area/marketplace is still being worked on.  The pool is adequate in size and nicely maintained.  Parking was

Hotel overall is average.  The lobby was just renovated a few months ago. It looks ok, not great.  The workout facility is good enough.  The hallways and carpet look old.  The rooms are good - average Marriott.  If you have status, the hotel has a lounge on the 6th floor.  It's a nice touch - staff there are usually nice and helpful.  Hotel also has a pool and hot tub, although I've never used it.
Manager Response: Greetings brandstudere:   Thank you so much for taking the time to post feedback on your stay! We always appreciate hearing feedback from our guests as it gives us the opportunity to continually improve our services.  As you mentioned, indeed we are going through a refresh! With our lobby recently completing renovation, we have already started progress on our model guest room; a room that we look forward to showing off to our guests in the coming weeks! We are very excited to offer our guests a fresh Marriott experience not only in the lobby but all throughout the hotel in the coming months!   I would be honored to be considered your point of contact should your travels return you to the Fullerton area!   Warmest Regards,  Dianne Floryan General Manager

Summary: I booked this location online. Great location and plenty of places to walk to and dine. In the last 6 months, I have stayed at hotels that are getting a face lift, updated and being renovated. It would be nice if this is posted on line when you book your stay. One of the elevators were out of service...long periods on waiting. My room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel staff were great and doing the best they could.
Manager Response: Dear Joe B,   We appreciate you taking the time to comment on your previous stay at the Fullerton Marriott. I apologize for a few issues you experienced during your visit. Our team strives to provide a great overall experience, and it seems as we fell short of our goal. As you mentioned, our property is near completion to the beginning stages of our renovation plan that includes our front desk and restaurant area. Our intention is never to deceive our guests about the condition of the hotel. I apologize if the information was not given to you prior to booking. I will be reaching out to our director of sales and marketing to confirm that this information is posted through all booking channels  as it has been from the beginning. Furthermore, with the safety of our guests in mind we made the decision to shut down one of the elevators to undergo preventative maintenance. We understand how this unexpected incident made a huge impact on your stay and for that we sincerely apologize. I hope that we can regain your trust and that you once again visit us when our renovation has been fully completed.  Best,

Summary: Came for a wedding in town and stayed en masse at this Marriott,  The hotel is conveniently located to Cal Fullerton and the 57 freeway.  I was a bit concerned upon check in because reception was tucked away while the main lobby and apparently the lounge area is being remodeled but except for being somewhat unadorned, it was fine and functional.  The rooms and bathrooms were clean and also comfortable but their configuration could use an facelift.  It was quite odd to enter a room and find an unnecessary wall right in front of you!  It made the space feel somewhat claustrophobic.  As check in is at 4 and we were meeting friends in the lobby, it would have been sensible for the bar to be open before 4:30 but that's just a thought.  I would stay here again if the need arose.

Had business at Cal State Fullerton and this hotel is right on the corner of campus....renovations are going on with the lobby, but did not affect my stay at all.....right next to the 57 highway also and many food choices in the area.

Hotel is located right on the edge of the Cal State Fullerton campus.  Lots of free parking available.  Several places to eat across the street and nearby, also in the hotel.  Hotel was currently undergoing remodeling so it was a little out of sorts but still lovely.  Staff was super nice at the front desk.  Had the standard king-bed room which had plenty of space.  Bathroom was small but decent.  The bed was not adjacent to the room next door so that was nice.  TV was on the side of the room as opposed to normally in front of the foot of the bed, so it was a little awkward to watch while in bed.  Room service was prompt and tasty.  Lots of local decor, especially what I assume is CSUF sports.  Only weird thing was that nothing in the room seemed to really match, i.e. the

Summary Heading: On-Campus Hotel for Cal State Fullerton
Summary: Being devoted Marriott hotel patrons (and timeshare owners) we opted to stay at this property while attending a college graduation.  While location is almost everything, and this hotel is actually on the campus, other expectations were not met.  The hotel is run under contract with Marriott by a group of investors (as I was told by employees).  It is under a major renovation as of May 2014, so hopefully it will look and act more like a Marriott in the future.  In all ways, the rooms and the service, this hotel is definitely not up to Marriott's standards.  While the employees try to do their best, they all seem young and inexperienced.  The rooms are small but clean.  There are several other hotels in the area that probably cost less, and until this Marriott has been rebuilt, I
Manager Response: Dear Dorothy F,  I'd like to begin by congratulating whomevers graduation you were celebrating. It's a tremendous accomplishment and truly a special moment to capture. Furthermore we appreciate your loyalty to the Marriott brand and would like to clear up any questions you may have about our property. We hold ourselves to a high standard when it comes to delivering excellent customer service. I apologize for any issues you may have experienced  during your previous stay. As you noticed we are currently undergoing a renovation that began in February 2015. We are anticipating the completion to occur within the next month (June 2015) with no minor setbacks. Our plans is to continue our renovation with the rooms and hallways after finishing the lobby/restaurant. Unfortunately, no date has been set.   If you have the opportunity, I'd like to better understand the complications you had with our service. We hold ourselves to the same Marriott standards as any other property and it seems as if we fell short. Once again I hope you accept our apology and wish to hear from you soon.

Summary: We stayed just one night and the hotel is currently in remodel mode for the lobby, front desk and restaurant. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the pool and university. Property is a little dated, but our room was nice, clean, good amenities, quiet and the bed was awesome!!! Room rate was moderate for a Saturday and lots of nearby restaurants. Would absolutely stay there again. k

We stayed here for 1 night because we arrived 1 day before our reservations at Anaheim (the hotel in Anaheim was sold out for the night). The hotel is currently undergoing extensive lobby renovations and the pool is closed. This is clearly disclosed on the website and when you make your reservations so it was not a surprise. There are signs that state if you need to use the pool, the hotel will shuttle you to the Residence Inn.   Elevators were slow (apparently this is due to renovations), which resulted in some bottlenecks. Check-in was fast and efficient. Room was standard Marriott decor and was clean and fresh smelling. Despite our room facing the freeway, soundproofing was quite good, and we didn't hear much noise. Parking is free at this hotel, which is unusual for the

Wow this place is in need of a renovation.  They are in the midst of the renovation.  Old rooms are really old and dated. Smelly. Banged up furniture.  Igh. Wait to stay here until the reno is done!  Parking is on site but is at a cost.  Even though I did the mobile check in it took 15 minutes to check in. Ugh.  Not a good Marriott.
Manager Response: Dear travelsforworkBoston,  I'd like to thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your previous stay at the Fullerton Marriott. I apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced throughout your stay. Our team is fully committed on presenting a property that our Marriott guests have become accustomed. With that being said, we our currently undergoing a renovation to reach that goal. We anticipate the renovation to be completed by mid - late June.  I am concerned with the timing of your check in and would like to follow up with you whenever you have an opportunity.   Best,  Henry Flores

Summary Heading: Good weekend price, while lobby renovated
Summary: Hotel lobby is going through major renovations so I was able to get a room on the weekend for $103+ tx. Which was good price for the area. Once the renovations are finished it seems this will be a cool place to stay. Room was big, clean and comfortable...

Summary Heading: Remodeling Continues but Still a Great Place to Stay
Summary: Had to take care of some family business in the Fullerton area and needed a place to stay since I'm from northern California.  Stayed at the Fullerton Marriott in early April 2015. According to the hotel's website, the restaurant and pool were being remodeled so that was not a surprise when I arrived.    The front desk representative was very friendly and gave me a 10% discount coupon when she realized that my stay was due to an unfortunate family matter.  That was very kind.    Although the restaurant was closed, the hotel set up dinning in one of the meeting rooms which filled the void.    The room was clean and up to expectations.  Parking was free but they do offer paid parking to the CSUF students.  Ample parking was still available but if the student parking filled up the

We stayed at this hotel for a weekend wedding.  The lobby was under construction as well as the pool area.  We did receive an upgrade but our room faced the freeway and the noise was terrible.  The property really needs an upgrade.
Manager Response: Dear Ibbecky,  I'd like to begin by wishing that you had a great time at the wedding you attended and thanking you for selecting our property. As you mentioned, we are currently undergoing a renovation in our restaurant and pool area. Our team understands how inconvenient this process is for all of our guests. With that being said, we are fully committed to providing our guests with a fantastic experience from beginning to end. The goal is to present and produce outstanding customer service while presenting a highly functional and stylish space that meet the modern needs of our valued guests, like you.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Fullerton Marriott at California State University on your next visit to Fullerton so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   Best,

Summary: We stayed at this Marriott to watch a softball tournament at Cal State Fullerton. First surprise was the entire lobby area and restaurant are under construction so there was very little common area to just sit and read the paper or visit. The limited lobby area that was available had worn uncomfortable furniture. The pool area looked nice but upon closer inspection, it needed to be cleaned and I never saw anyone skim the pool during our 3 day stay. Although our room was just fine, housekeeping came in and made the bed, took out trash but did not replace the toiletries or take pool towels from the room. All the staff were very nice and helpful, my overall impression is that there simply were not enough staff to keep the hotel up. While I completely understand how disruptive
Manager Response: Dear Molly M,  First and foremost, we would like to thank you for the constructive feedback you provided. As you mentioned, our property is currently undergoing a full renovation. As you can imagine, we have encountered certain road blocks that we hit along the way that at times slows our momentum. Nonetheless, the renovation team is moving rapidly in order to provide the finished product to our guests.   Rest assure that the pool is cleaned daily by one of our engineers in the beginning of his shift (typically 7am - 8am) and once again in the afternoon. I apologize if the condition of the pool was not up to  par during your stay and for any inconvenience you experienced with the room service.   We hope that we can regain your trust and that you choose to visit our property once the renovation has been completed. Feel free to contact us for any updates to the renovation.   Best,

Summary Heading: Under construction in the lobby Feb 16 2015
Summary: The lobby was undergoing some construction the week of February 16. Brandon  at the counter was friendly, attentive and checked me in quickly explaining where the restaurant was relocated during construction and the hours of the gym and its location.  My room was located on the back of the hotel away from the street traffic so I was not exposed to the noise..  The room was clean, quite except when the air unit kicked on.  It sounded like a small plane engine.  The bed was typical ultra comfortable at Marriott. Aside from the construction, I would stay here again.  I reduced my rating as to the amount of construction in the lobby.

Summary Heading: WALK TO CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY FULLERTON
Summary: The hotel entrance is a couple of blocks from the freeway.  The hotel is located right next to California State University Fullerton.  It is short walk to the arena from the hotel.  The double bed room was a little small.  The service of the hotel staff was outstanding.

This hotel used to have some severe problems with their internet but that seems to have been fixed.  Overall it is dated and kind of worn down, but the staff is generally helpful and well trained, and the rooms are kept reasonably clean.  If you need to be on campus, or just in the area, this hotel will get the job done.  Overall an average Marriott experience.

Went there for a business meeting. Arrived late at night, parking spaces were ample and easily located in front of the hotel. After I checked in, they sent some staff to help me figure out how to adjust the thermostat. At my request, they even wheeled in a small fridge for me to store my milk at no extra cost, which is beyond my expectation. While we had meeting the next day at one of the hotel's meeting rooms, a staff was appointed to paticularly attend to our needs. The only improvement I'd like to see is the cleaniness of the glasses we use to drink water. The property looks nice overall and the staff there are friendly and helpful. I'll be happy to stay at this hotel again.

After reading a few of the recent reviews I was a little concerned about staying here but I was pleasantly surprised.  I thought my room was fine.  Bathroom was clean, plenty of towels and plenty of hot water available. The lighting could be a little better and a make up mirror would have been nice.  The bed was comfortable and the desk was spacious to work on.  They do need more outlets so you can plug iphones and computers in.  The room was quiet even though it seemed the hotel was full. The hotel itself was fine. The staff was helpful and accommodating. They have cold water available in the lobby and one day they had cookies also.  The hotels restaurant was fine, I ate both dinner and breakfast.  Food was good. All in all I think this hotel was fine.  They are going to

Summary Heading: Tired and in need of a facelift
Summary: Stayed 2 nights for business.  Hotel is kind of outdated.  Concierge lounge is too small and cramped for this size hotel.  Standard Marriott room furnishings.  Fitness room was also small.  It is close to shopping and dining.
Manager Response: Dear John B.  I'd like to begin by thanking you for taking the time to comment on your previous stay. We take all of the feedback given by our guest extremely crucial especially with our renovation set to begin this quarter. Our team is working diligently to provide a venue that will work with all of our guests needs. We hope that you can give us the opportunity when your travels bring you back to Fullerton.

Summary: Stayed at this Marriott for 3 nights during the New Years Holiday.  In all honestly, I only stayed at this hotel because I am a Marriott Platinum Member and had a certificate that was about to expire.  If it wasn't for that, I would have stayed at the Anaheim Marriott.    Service was good.  I was contacted by the hotel Manager days before check in to confirm my stay and to ask if there was anything I needed.  I thought this was wonderful.  Upon arriving, I was taken a back with how dated and unkept the hotel was.  Even the furniture in the lobby looked old and dirty.  The kind that you would probably be afraid to sit in.  I couldn't help but notice while walking through the hallway that there were lots of scuff marks and just a lot of wear and tear on the walls and the carpets.
Manager Response: Dear QBee10,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your previous stay at the Fullerton Marriott. We hope that you and your family enjoyed all the holidays this past season and that you have begun 2015 in a great way. We strive to provide each guest with excellent service at every encounter. I hope that we achieved that with you during your stay. Our team is fully aware of the condition of our property and that improvements "need" and "will be" made. We are scheduled to undergo a full renovation during the first quarter of this year. The process will begin with our lobby and restaurant area. It will then conclude with the rooms and hallways of each floor. Our goal is to provide a hotel that you (Platinum Member) are accustomed when travelling to Marriott's around the country and the world. This process will take time but we understand that this is absolutely necessary. We hope that you will once again revisit us once our property has completed the renovation.

Summary Heading: SOUND THE HORN, Outstanding service, Beautiful property, and the Ha Penny
Summary: Management and staff make this Marriott property one worth visiting. Building and grounds are well maintained, secure and properly lighted, enhancing the FREE PARKING. Yes FREE PARKING. Only 3 miles to Disney Parks, make this facility a value in itself. Easily accessed from Highway 57 on Nutwood Ave, the neighborhood is the home of California State University. There are many dining options around, but you must try Ha Penny's, the Resorts lobby restaurant. Incredible food, from morning buffet or menu, to late evening, for arriving guests. Ha Penny's has an Irish flair with traditional choices at reasonable prices. Everyone here, ensures the guest that they are valued and appreciated, just what you expect from an industry leader like Marriott. Initiating renovations soon, designs

Summary Heading: Outstanding location, wonderful staff, excellent food.
Summary: For a Hotel so close to the Disney Parks, it was surprising to find free parking, available lodging and a wonderful array of dining choices in the area, especially Ha Penny, located with in hotel.  The Hotel and staff has charm, and displays the excellence expected within the Marriott brand. Building and grounds are well maintained, lighted and secure. Staff is efficient, friendly and attentive. Rooms are large enough for 2 Queen beds, but only currently have double beds, plenty of space and electrical support to recharge a family's worth of gadgets. Bathroom provides a clean, modern design, but could use addition of lighted mirror for shaving and make up. Upgrade designs are displayed in the lobby with initiation to come.  Ha Penny, Hotel's dining room, is a wonderful dining

Yes the place needs a renovation which is starting in 2015. But what makes this place special is the service...and the care of the staff. Stayed December 2014 for the Holidays and could not have been more pleased.

Summary Heading: Proximity To University is Worth The Stay
Summary: If you are looking to for a Hotel to stay that is within walking distance to CAL-State Fullerton, then this is it. This Marriott is located right across the street from the University and it is certainly within walking distance to a lot of places to go eat. This hotel is and old Marriott property and has not been renovated like many others, no the staff's fault of course. Did not try the food or drinks from the Irish Pub in the lobby, but staff seem friendly and professional. Hotel rooms were priced properly, specially for GOVT employees. I gave this hotel an average rating as it is pretty standard for Marriott properties.
Manager Response: Dear Hamilton L,  First and foremost thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Fullerton Marriott. As you mentioned we are extremely close in proximity to the CSUF campus. I'm pleased to hear that our staff came across as friendly and professional. We strive to achieve that goal with every guest that we encounter. Furthermore, you wrote about the condition of our property. Which brings me great joy to inform you that we will be undergoing a full renovation this upcoming year (first quarter in 2015). Our transformation is scheduled to begin with our lobby and restaurant. It will then conclude with the hallways and rooms. Our team is confident that the facelift will provide the setting guests are accustomed to a Marriott property. We hope that you can give us a second chance when your travels bring you back to Fullerton.   Happy Holiday,

Summary: I have recurring trips to the area and find they are well placed and the usually young staff is very personable. I also used the college track adjacent to go for walks and jogging. Also convenient to Anaheim area.

Very out dates decor very dull needs a new fresh look. I understand will start renovating in 2015 will see the outcome and timing. Would not stay again or recommend this Marriott property until it is updated. Being a Platinum elite member upgraded to a suite it's much larger room but very dated. I stayed here only because my category 4 certificate was expiring in a few weeks otherwise I would have stayed at the Anaheim Marriott convention center. What really have the 4 star is the service I received from Michele at checkin and during my stay, she really knows Customer Serivce and it was not because I am A Platinum member she provided the same level of service to other guest with a great attitude and smile. Location is good and convenient. The lounge on the 6th floor was closed
Manager Response: Dear 359miraloma,  First and foremost, thank you for taking the time to comment on your previous stay at the Fullerton Marriott. As you mentioned our property is in need of a "new look". Furthermore, you are correct with our plans to eliminate this ongoing issue we've been battling. We are anticipating a renovation to occur in the first quarter of next year. Our team is confident that the final product will measure up to any other property in terms of décor. I'm extremely pleased that Michelle was able to provide excellent service. She is definitely an asset to our team and she and our team understand that the service we provide will be what we hang our hat on.We hope that you will revisit our property once the renovation has been completed.

Summary: Nothing really wrong with this property, it is just very out dated and a little bit shabby.  The staff was friendly and I picked it because of the location.  It needs a top down remodel, and maybe a little more attention to details. it is not up to Marriott standards, but it might be the the best option for the area.
Manager Response: Dear WarrenTravels,  Thank you for commenting on your previous stay. You mentioned your displeasure with the look of the property. Our team is fully aware that the rooms are beginning to show its age and that a makeover is desperately needed. With that being said, we are happy to inform you that our hotel will be undergoing a full renovation that is scheduled to begin in January. The process will begin wit our lobby and restaurant. From there, we will work our way up to the rooms and hallways. This process will take some time but we are committed on providing a higher quality to all of our guests. We hope that you will once again choose to stay at our hotel when your travels bring you back to Fullerton.

Summary Heading: Great place and location for a seminar
Summary: I was at a seminar today at this hotel and was very impressed with the staff, the service and the quality of the lunch that was served.  While this hotel is a little dated and starting to show it's age, I found out from one of the very friendly staff members that it is due to be renovated starting next month.  So that should give it a new look.  The lunch was chicken (go figure), but I have to say that it was probably one of the better chicken lunches that I have had at one of these kinds of function.  My compliments to the chef!  I would recommend this hotel for this kind of event, but I'd wait until it's renovated.  It was easy to find, easy to park and easy access to get to the ballroom where the event was to be held.

We stayed here one night. My son had a swim meet near by. I had called the hotel directly to reserve a room and specifically requested a quiet room and that was request was honored. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. Yes, the hotel lobby is dated and the hallways too. The staff upon check-in and out were efficient,professional and helpful. Thank you Mary for printing out directions to the nearest Catholic church,you were so kind.

First, the staff is wonderfully amazing.  They provided a WOW experience at every turn.  So my rating for them is a 5.....the hotel itself if quite dated and in need of updating/upgrades.  In the lobby there is a poster announcing a coming remodel....several years behind schedule in my view.  The location to the University is great.  Would like to come back after the remodel.
Manager Response: Dear Troy B,  I'd like to begin by thanking you for taking the time to comment on your previous stay. I'm pleased to know that our staff delivered an amazing service. As you mentioned we will be undergoing a full renovation which is scheduled to begin in January. Our team is excited for the future of our property as we understand the importance and necessity of the transformation. We hope that you revisit our property once the renovation is complete.

Summary: I have stayed for a total of three weeks at this Marriott. My previous stay was on the second floor. Very cramped room with no view. It was clean and comfortable. This week's stay was much nicer. I had a view and the room was much larger. Very quiet both stays. The only drawback is there is no mini-fridge or microwave in the the rooms. Other than that, everything else was very good. Great staff both stays also.

I had a lovely stay. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff really went the extra mile. I forgot my shoes in my room and Michael from the front desk actually arranged to bring them to me all the way to Pasadena. Thank you!!

Front desk person is very professional and friendly. Although the hotel shows its aging, but the lobby and room are very clean and well maintained. Plenty of parking space are available. Location is within 15 minutes driving distance to Disneyland whether by freeway or local. My only complain would be the towels in the bathroom. They are old and need to be replaced.

I don't usually write reviews on the hotels I stay in for business travel.  The things that would be important for leisure vs. the things that would matter during business don't even almost line up.  However, I decided to make an exception.  I have stayed at this hotel many times throughout the years.  And I keep on returning because it's really a well run hotel.    I am a Platinum member of the Marriott rewards program, so I have access to their Concierge Lounge, as well as free internet.  Many Gold/Platinum members receive upgrades, if available, but I must say I have never once been upgraded to anything other than their standard room...hum...I wonder if they even have suites.  I'm sure they do, but probably very few.  I may never know, but that's okay.  At first blush, the

Summary Heading: Good Hotel and good location in Fullerton
Summary: Recently stayed at the hotel for a long business trip.  The room, service, and overall facility was very good.  Dined there for a few meals and the service and food were excellent.  I will definitely return in the near future.

Some say it is dated, but our room was very nice, the beds were excellent the towels were great..  The staff was very nice.  The place my be a little dated, but other wise it is clean.  This is our third visit and we will return.

I stayed here on a recent business trip.  I was very happy with the service.  I arrived early and was able to get into my room.  We were also able to arrange a last minute suite for work during the day at a very reasonable price.  A very nice location with plenty of restaurants only a short drive away.  And helpful staff.  I would definitely consider it again.  As for the room it was a little dark for me, but so are most hotel rooms.  I went with the upgraded wifi (free with my Marriott Rewards membership level) and had no issues with streaming video as there was plenty of bandwidth.  Had lunch at the hotel restaurant.  It was a good meal, well priced.

Summary Heading: Ok hotel for the location. Good bar service and good location to college
Summary: This hotel is typical for a business hotel. Great bar, great Internet and very clean.   We stayed for a wedding party and it was not perfect for that occasion. Rooms were small, front desk was not attentive.   The bartenders at the lobby bar were great. Banquet service was great and the party was successful.   I wish I would have felt more important or respected by the front desk. I had a security alert on my credit card card from a recent business trip and the agent announced it to all the people in line waiting. " sir this credit card is declined". I had another card that went through but it was embarrassing at how she announced it so loud that everyone heard. The second issue was with them asking my room number for a replacement room key card and not my last name with id.
Manager Response: Dear Dan S,  Thank you for taking the time to share your past experience at our property. I speak on behalf of our management team and would like to apologize for any inconvenience/embarrassment that you may have experienced. Rest assure that I will be following up with my team to teach the proper way of handling both situations you mentioned. Once again I apologize and hope that we can regain your trust. Please feel free to contact me if you would like to discuss this matter further.

Summary: We stayed at this Marriott for five nights as were attending a conference.  Fortunately we had paid for the concierge floor, therefore enjoyed breakfast and light evening snacks which were very good, and of course free.  This kept us out of the hotel's dining room which is mediocre at best.  It is portrayed as an Irish Pub Style but is really a large open area without the ambience of a Pub.  The exception to the dining area is on the weekend when the buffet is in effect  --  this is excellent. Other than the "restaurant" dining, the hotel service was superb.  The staff is friendly and couldn't do enough to make our stay most enjoyable. We required an additional chair in the room  --  this arrived within five minutes.  The room, although quite small was clean, well serviced with

Ended up staying here last night after the hotel I booked online near Disneyland was overbooked.  When we arrived, we were advised that they only had a room with 2 queens, not a king as booked.  Being 1am, we had no choice but to go upstairs and sleep.  Found the hotel to be dated.  Ceilings still have acoustic texture.  Room was clean, but bed and pillows were uncomfortable.  It's great when you plan a night away with your husband and have to sleep in two different beds.
Manager Response: Dear Queenofc   I'd like to start by thanking you for sharing your past experience at our property. I would also like to apologize for any inconveniences that you and your husband experienced when visiting the Disneyland Resort Area. Although we weren't your top choice to select we still would have liked to delivered a great experience for you and your husband. I hope your travels bring you back to our property so we can better prepare for all of your needs.

Summary: Great location, but this hotel is very dated, rooms are small and offer no amenities at all  The hall area where we were was dirty.  Common area was open and kept. I also was mischarged at check out by the hotel and they took it upon themselves to add an additional charge without notifying me of this. This meant i submitted an incorrect charge to my expense account that has created more work for me.  I did request they reverse the charge, but they declined even after admitting their error.
Manager Response: Dear rknitle,  Thank you for taking the time to share your previous experience at our property. I'm glad that our hotel served as a great location for all of your travelling needs. Furthermore, I do want to add that there are amenities offered at our property which include: high speed internet, swimming pool (open till 11pm), fitness center (open 24 hours), room service (6a-12a), and breakfast (15.00 USD). I also would like to extend my apologies for any billing issues that occurred. Please feel free to contact me if you would like to discuss the topic further.

Summary Heading: Good Accomodations, Nice Personnel, Pleasant Stay
Summary: I have to admit that I liked the hotel for longer stays and I returned to this property a few times. It is true that in the meantime the management changed and cannot say that the services improved, on the contrary they diminished. The coffee in the lobby disappeared under the excuse to be available in the room. Not the same thing for a guest, believe us the ones to travel as always you are missing something or you would like to have one readily available on the go.  The WI-FI internet was improved as the first time on the premises was never able to get connected in the room. Nice swimming pool and exercise room.  Rooms are fine, decent size and furnishings, bed is good, always plenty pillows, very nice bathroom goodies.  The personnel is very nice and tries hard to acommodate

I was attending a conference at Cal State and was put up here. It is very convenient for those needing to be on campus--it is literally right at the edge of campus and I was able to walk to my meetings. Parking and WIFI were included in the rate, which was nice. The on-site restaurant was good--their breakfast buffet was great for about $13. My king room was a bit small and there were plumbing issues in the bathroom--the sink kept filling with dirty water all by itself, as well as not draining properly when I used it. The amenities in the room were all very nice. The staff was extremely friendly and professional! I really felt well taken care of by them. This hotel is just fine and you won't go wrong here. I just felt that the rate was a little steep and the room a bit
Manager Response: Dear TravelGuy72, first and foremost we would like to thank you for taking the time to comment on your previous stay. As you can imagine we are a prime destination for guests travelling to the Cal State Fullerton campus. I'm pleased to hear that the location and most importantly the  service provided throughout your stay was accommodating. Furthermore,  I would like to personally apologize for the issues encountered in your bathroom. I hope that we were able to fix the issue immediately in order for you and the family to enjoy the amenities in the room. We hope to once again serve as your choice of stay when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: The hotel was clean and relatively updated (as compared with the other large hotel in the area I last stayed at). Service was professional and friendly. The breakfast buffet was good (included in my rate).  The gym was small but had more than adequate equipment choice for a short stay.  Unfortunately the sauna was not working.
Manager Response: PeppeWrangler,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with a review of your last experience with us! Glad that hear that you were satisfied with your stay! I am sorry to hear about the sauna issue, however it has been fixed and it is up and running now!  I am glad that you were able to join us for breakfast, maybe during your next stay with us you can join us for lunch and/or dinner!  Again thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback!

Summary: I had a great time at this hotel. The staff are friendly and very professional. The hotel room was wonderful but the setup was straight from the 70s. I even had a great breakfast meat there plus a few drinks!
Manager Response: Dear DonaDiabla,   Thank you for sharing your comments in regards to your previous stay. I'm ecstatic to hear that our staff provided you with the proper service you come to expect. We hope that your travels brings you back to our property in the near future.

Summary Heading: truly a home away from home
Summary: i am staying at this hotel for medical reasons for two months (april-may 2014) and i feel i have found a new home. the staff is phenomenal and i want to recognize them by name: chris, analia, david, alex, karina, peter, jordan, matt, nicole, giovanni, michelle, jasmine (front desk), sergio, lucy, jessica, bianka (restaurant/bar), marisela, pam (housekeeping). this is a very difficult time in my life and the marriott definitely makes things easier. thank you.
Manager Response: Dear godard17,  On behalf of our staff we would like to thank you for taking the time to comment on your previous stay. We have shared your comments to the staff members who were mentioned above. We wish you the best during this difficult time period  and hope to welcome you back to soon.

Summary: As a regular business traveler, I stay at Marriott properties, normally Marriott Hotels.  When comparing this Marriott Hotel to other full-service Marriotts, I'd say this one is in the top 5.  The facilities are great, parking is close and convenient.  The entire staff is very friendly and professional, and they have gone out of their way to help may my stay better.  As a platinum member, I have access to the concierge lounge and eat there at breakfast and supper.  The morning hostess does an excellent job in keeping the food stocked.  The variety is as good as I've seen, even when comparing to a much larger one (i.e Marriott Hotel - North Michigan - Chicago).  Iove the assortment of fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, and breakfast meat.  The hostess for the evening is very friendly,
Manager Response: Dear Ken B,  I'd like to begin by thanking you for your loyalty to Marriott and for sharing your experience at our property. We understand that as a Platinum Member you have stayed at numerous Marriott's around the world. It brings our staff much joy to hear that you labeled us as your top 5  Marriott property. I am also thrilled that you were able to take advantage of the amenities provided for you such as: the fitness center and concierge room access. As always we strive to provide each guests with excellent service and am pleased that each encounter was exactly that.    Furthermore, we have taken note of the television on the treadmill and are working on fixing the issue. Once again we appreciate you taking the time to comment on your stay.

Summary Heading: Good for one night. Centrally located
Summary: Me and my wife were looking to spend our first night away from our baby and get a little rest. We booked the hotel through priceline bidding service and were glad it was centrally located to food, entertainment, etc.  The room was a little outdated, set up a little strange but was big enough to room 2 adults and maybe a child. The bathroom was spacious enough and the tv was nice. The hotel itself was fairly outdated but not too bad. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and there was always someone at the front desk.   The biggest plus was definitely that it was close to the mall, freeway and food/bars. I wouldn't go back just because it's nothing special but it was an average stay with no negatives.
Manager Response: Mr. Perez,   First and foremost, congratulations on the baby! That is always good news! Thank you for taking the time to provide us with a quick review. I am glad that we were able to provide what you were looking for in regards to a centralized location to different venues/restaurants in the area.  You are correct to say that we are in need of a renovation and I am happy to say that one is coming soon as we are starting with the lobby in November and the room are to come shortly after that. If you are uncertain with staying with us until then, I cannot be upset with that. But I would certainly hope that you visit us when we have completed our "facelift".   I hope that you and your wife continue to have an amazing time with the new baby!!!  Jasmin Randle Assistant General Manager Fullerton Marriott Hotel

Summary Heading: Perfect location when working with CSF
Summary: This hotel is a great location for visiting or working with CSF. Stayed here a few days for work project.  Hotel is showing it's age in some areas, but they are trying to keep thins up.  Staff is friendly and we had what we needed. If Mariott is making some money on this property, they may wish to invest in some updates and upgrades.  Comfortable and business worthy.  On-site bar and restaurant (at there for breakfast buffet, which was good and average).   Would return.

An older but very nice property.  Easy access on and off the freeway and sits at the very edge of the CSU, Fullerton campus.  Great location, lots of restaurants in the area.  Comfortable rooms.  Staff is very friendly.

Summary Heading: Just don't expect a typical Marriott; otherwise it's perfectly acceptable
Summary: They mean it when they say "at CSU", as in, not adjacent, but ON the campus. You share a parking garage with students, potentially. That's not a bad thing, but it should temper your expectations. While check-in was quick, and the area was good for access to the CSU and a bunch of other restaurants, the entire experience is not that of a Marriott. They really should rebrand to Courtyard or something similar. There are always at least a handful of (presumably) students in the lobby or restaurant, and while it's not loud or annoying (usually), it creates an odd atmosphere- like your room is above a food court or something. The room was small- just enough room for the desk, chair, and king bed, and the little hallway with the closet and bathroom door was very cramped. This works

Had a horrible recent weekend stay.  Checked in on a Friday, went to bed early at 9pm (well, that's early for me!) was woken up by a group of men making much noise out by the pool. The pool closes at 11pm so I waited till 1130pm still noisey...called the front desk...they said they would "handle" the situation...MIDNITE...still very noisey...called the front desk...1230am called the front desk...waited 15 minutes, still noisey...got dressed and went to the front desk. Was told that the group had just left the building. I'm thinking, "If they were'nt staying at the hotel why were they there AND why were they allowed to  disturb paying guests such as myself."  The answer would never come.  Sunday night after watching the season premiere of "Game of Thrones" at 10pm I settled in
Manager Response: Daniel H  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your last experience with us! I apologize that you had to go through such an ordeal in regards to my staff having to call the police. Unfortunately, the weekends in Fullerton do not always bring the quietest guests and I know that my staff do what is in their power to handle the situation, however at times it is in the best interest of our guests, the front desk staff, and the hotel in general to allow law enforcement to handle such situations as they are more experienced to do so. Nonetheless, a call should have been made earlier than what it was.   We have taken a proactive approach in preventing a similar situation from happening again which will include my Night Audit team taking property walks around the hotel during the weekend and during days in which we are at high occupancy as to prevent a problem from happening before it starts. The same is to be said about the closing time of the pool area.   So again, I thank you for bringing these matters to our attention and we are doing what we can to prevent them from occurring again.

Summary: We enjoyed our recent stay at this family friendly hotel.  The decor is out dated and can use some sprucing up though.  Our room was clean, well stocked and comfortable.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Easy access to hotel from the Fwy 57 and next door to Cal State Fullerton University.  Budget Friendly eateries within a mile from the hotel (Denny's, Jack-in-Box and The Habit Burger Grill).  Outdoor Pool and Jacuzzi area a plus.  Our overall stay was well worth the $.
Manager Response: Dear TheresaZ_11,  First and foremost, I would like to take the opportunity to thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback and experience with us! There is no doubt that without the feedback of our guests, we would not be conscious of the areas that are in need of improvement at our property, as well as those areas that deserve a pat on the back.  Thank you for taking the time to compliment our hotel staff as well as noticing the cleanliness of our guest rooms. Our Housekeeping staff take great pride in the work that they put into each guest room, so it is nice to see it get recognized. I will be sure to pass along the praises! Our hotel is a bit dated and in need of a renovation and I am excited to say that it is in the plans for this year! I would love to start it as soon as possible, but I have not been made aware of the start date quite yet.   Thank you again for taking the time to leave your feedback!

Summary: I've stayed at this Marriott property twice and both times my stay has been great.  The room was very clean, service was great.  The restaurant inside the hotel is very good as well.  I like the 12:00 check out!  I will stay here again!!

The Marriott Fullerton does a fine job with hospitality, cleanliness and comfort.  The location is excellent right on the campus of Cal State, at the Nutwood exit off the 57 and adjacent to Hope International University.  For all you architecture buffs, the Hope campus is a textbook example of mid-century modern Googie architecture designed by Eldon Davis.  Check it out!

I was here for some business meetings. The location is handy, right off the freeway and close to the college (Cal State Fullerton) . On entering the lobby I passed a very dated looking "Pub" and felt like I had just wandered into the 80's. My immediate thought was "this place could use an update".   My room was on the 4th floor and as I walked the hallway to the room, I noticed multiple patches of wall paper missing all along the hallway, apparently some type of repair work had been done to the wall and the wallpaper had not been replaced.It looked pretty ragged.  The room was small and somewhat dated with very sparse look, more like a hospital room or barracks than a hotel. The furnishings were dated and worn. The towels were thin and some had a noticeable gray tint, kind of
Manager Response: Dear FargoJim  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback of your most recent stay. There is no doubt that without the feedback of our guests, we would not be conscious of the areas in which need improvement.   In regards to the need of a renovation, I am happy to say that we will begin the first steps towards that renovation this year! I unfortunately cannot give a set in stone start date, but I do know that we are planning to start with the lobby and integrating Marriott's Great Room concept, which consists of revamping the entire lobby and restaurant area. I have been told that the rooms will be hit after that. With the renovation of the guestrooms, the hallways are in the works to be done. The "patchwork" that you see being done in the hallways on the guest room floors was actually an upgrade to our Internet service. We recently added quite a few more access points in our hotel to allow for faster and more readily accessible Internet access. Naturally, we did not want to leave the holes in the walls until the renovation of the rooms, so that would explain the process that is going on in the hallways of our guest rooms. I do agree with you in that there are areas of the hotel that do require a lot more tender loving care than others, but I am happy to say that we plan on hitting all the areas that are in need of just that. While I know it is a process, I am glad to say that we are heading in the right direction. We do strive to offer nothing less than satisfaction to our guests and I'm sorry that we have fallen short during your stay.  I am sorry that our hotel does not currently meet you expectations but I am very confident in saying that we will soon be there, if not exceed those same expectations! Again, thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. If there is anything further that I can do for you, please do not hesitate to ask.  Jasmin Randle

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for hospitality for a debate tournament hosted at CSU Fullerton for 3 days. The hotel staff was excellent and the rooms were not bad at all. The snacks at the convenience store were a bit overpriced but thats about it!
Manager Response: KevonH,   Thank you so much for taking the time to leave the positive feedback about our property! We are happy to be your hosts for the Debate tournament year after year! With that being said, looking forward to seeing you next year also!!  Jasmin Randle Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Nice location at an average hotel
Summary: I spent one night here while attending a conference.  The room was comfortable and reasonably clean.  The mattress was actually better than expected.  The facility seems dated and in need of upgrades, but the staff was pleasant and the hotel met my short-terms needs.  While the location is good, it is quite close to the 57 FWY.  It's a good thing I had earbuds or the traffic noise would have been a problem.  I would recommend this hotel for short stays.
Manager Response: To SkyLordHeuksa  Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback on your most recent visit to our property! Definitely appreciate the feedback as it is the only way for us to continue to improve and address problem areas!  I am very happy to hear the praises in regards to the staff and I will be sure to pass that along to the rest of the management team as I am sure they will be happy to share that with their employees!  Glad to hear that you enjoyed the mattress, that is actually a common compliment that we receive! They are quite comfortable!  In regards to the traffic noise, I am sorry to hear that it may have disrupted your night. In the future, if you choose to stay with us again, you are more than welcome to shoot me an email after your reservation has been made and I will do everything in my power to pre-block you in a room that faces the pool area, which tends to be quite a bit more quiet!  Thank you again for taking the time to leave your opinion, it is must appreciated!  Jasmin Randle Front Office Manager Fullerton Marriott Hotel jrandle@marriottfullerton.com

Summary: I was attending meetings and playing golf in Orange County a couple of months ago, mainly in Fullerton, and I decided to give this place a try. The location right on the campus of CSUF was very convenient for getting to where I needed to be. I usually like staying in college towns and near university campuses for the usually wide range of restaurants and generally safe surroundings, but seeing as CSUF is more of a commuter school there's not much within walking distance.  As for the hotel itself, everything saying that it is dated is true and it could use a bit of a renovation. The public areas and the room were certainly looking their age in terms of furnishings and decor, but everything was kept to reasonable standards of cleanliness. The bathroom in my room did seem like it

The location is good however the staff was not super friendly or accommodating but that is ok.  The hotel is old and needs to be updated, it simply looks and feels old. The lounge serves food that while ok is neither exciting or great (ok not 100% fair the fresh fruit was very fresh but the rest tasted old (too long on the heat).  But the bed is comfortable and that is for me the main thing I want in a hotel other than reliable and fast internet access as I am here on business and need it for work. Well this hotel gets less than 3Mbps download and a whopping 680Kbps upload! Can I say forget VPN's forget remote access go have coffee as it's barely usable.  I would simply NOT come back until this is fixed and recommend that before you come here you need to decide if you need

At first I was hesitant about staying in Fullerton CA.  Not sure where this place was, but wanting to stay at an affordable place, the decision was easy.  Boy was I surprised by the EXCELLENT service I received.  My stay lasted 10 days.  Each day, I was greeted by a friendly staff member.  Did I also mention they were helpful as well?!  The room I stayed in was large, with two double beds.  The hotel had a decent gym which I used 4xs.  There was also an outdoor swimming pool, free parking and a good breakfast buffet (located in the bar/restaurant).  The rooms did not have a refrigerator, but had a small coffee maker. I would have preferred a small fridge since they provided coffee every morning and evening.  This hotel also had an executive lounge which provide non-alcoholic

Summary Heading: An older but still good Marriott
Summary: This is an older property but it is up to standards. Room was a little small but clean and well appointed. There is some noise on the highway side though. Ample parking in front of the hotel or adjacent parking structure It often has great rates and I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel with one big Issue
Summary: This is a good hotel in an upscale immediate surrounding area. You can expect a very clean room with everything working. Even the exhaust in the bathroom.  The big issue with this hotel is the Wi-Fi. It does not work. I was informed that the hotel had installed a new service but my service timed out for every web site I tried to reach. I reported this to management and they sent a technician to fix the problem. Still no web.  I stayed on the concierge level in #623. This is right in front of the elevators which I thought might be a problem but it was not even though the hotel was full.  Lots of free parking and good rates makes this hotel an excellent choice.

This hotel is right next door to California State University Fullerton (CSUF), Hope International University and right of off of the very busy 57 freeway. Service, staff, and management at this hotel are all first class and work very hard to provide the guest with a great enjoyable stay. How do I now????  Well, I have personally stayed in this hotel over 50 times in the last couple of year.... and this hotel seems to be a training ground, promoting and sending out managers for various top rated hotels in Orange County such as the Westin and the five star Resort at Pelican Hill. Within a short 5 minute walk from the hotel there is a Carls  Jr. located right on the CSUF campus.  Across the street from the  hotel is a strip mall the contains The Habit hamburger joint, Which Which

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Stay In The Area
Summary: First, let me start off by saying that I read all the negative reviews and was a little concerned about booking a stay here.  I am use to nice rooms with lots of amenities and did not want a shabby, run down hotel in need of repairs or refurbishments.  The Hotel looks nice from the outside when you drive up.  I'm thinking, this looks great.  I check in and was greeted by the friendliest front desk staff I have had in a very long time.  The young man was very accomodating to my request for a poolside room.  The room was not outdated for my taste and was very clean.  The King bed was very comfortable.  The grandkids, age 6-8, enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi.  I recomend the buffet breakfast which had a very good assortment of fruit, ceral, pastries, meats, potatoes, belgin waffles
Manager Response: Dear bako,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. I am so happy that you were able to experience our property for yourself. Our team does a wonderful job of accommodating all of our guests needs. We know how important it is for guests to feel comfortable and relaxed when traveling.  I appreciate you mentioning some of your favorite amenities that we offer. The restaurant that we have on property serves breakfast, lunch and dinner so that you can satisfy your hunger needs any time of day.   We hope to see you back for your next Disney trip!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Next to scenic college and great dining options
Summary: Excellent location right off the 57 freeway, about 10-15 minutes from Disneyland. Less than 10 minutes from Arrowhead Pond and Angels Stadium. Good breakfast buffet and staff. Front desk manager Nora gave us great dining recommendation!  We will be back...
Manager Response: Dear Richard R,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property. I appreciate you mentioning some of the wonderful attractions that are located near us. The Honda Center (formally known as Arrowhead Pond) hosts many hockey games, concerts and shows. The Angels Baseball Stadium is always great to visit for an good ‘ol American pastime.  I hope Nora's recommendation was delicious! See you again very soon.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Just not up to Marriott standards
Summary: In Brea for work, we stayed at the Marriott Fullerton for 3 nights. As a loyal Marriott Platinum Elite Member, I try to stay at Marriott facilities during travels. Unfortunately, this choice was a mistake.   Unfortunately, this facility is very old and has not been renovated in quite some time. Beds were in touch shape (my back hurt for 3 days), the bathrooms were dark and old, and ventilation in rooms was limited.   Staff was not the best, with exception of evening Concierge Lounge host (Shirley?). She was outstanding and one of the only reasons why I may go back to this facility once renovated. Overall, not a pleasant stay and I would suggest looking for other options in Fullerton until this facility is renovated.
Manager Response: Dear softballmom18,  First and foremost, thank you for going out of your way to write a review on your recent stay with us. Second, I would like to apologize that your stay was not up to par. As a Platinum Elite Member, we understand how much time and commitment you dedicate to Marriott’s. I agree that our property has experienced some ware and tear, with that being said, we are in the process of planning major renovations.   We would love for the opportunity to make things right.
