Please feel free to contact us so that we can have the opportunity exceed your expectations.   “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Great location if your son or daughter go to CSU Fullerton
Summary: Right on campus, so you can simply & safely walk anywhere on campus - really convienient for us as our family is from the UK & our son has travelled to be a Freshman at the University.  The hotel is a reasonable standard, rooms good although could use a fridge.  The gym & pool are modest in size, however very clean & with modern facilities & equipment.  The hotel bar & restuarant are a good standard too. Student discount made the cost affordable. Easy parking & access to all routes made this all round good experience.
Manager Response: Dear MB19,  Wow, I am sure the trip from the UK to the US was long and hectic. Luckily, you enjoyed a clean and comfortable stay that allowed you watch your son begin his new endeavor at Cal State Fullerton.  I am happy to see that our amenities such as our: restaurant, parking and pool really put the cherry on top of your trip. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back soon!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: Parking was a breeze and the hotel easy to navigate.   Hotel front desk were very helpful in getting our room checked in quickly.  They had a large group check in at the same time, yet were willing to help us
Manager Response: Dear TravelingDeuce,  I appreciate your review; it was short and “suite”. I am most glad to read that the team assisted you even with a large group checking in.   Come back again soon!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Staff make up for the aged condition of the property
Summary: This is an older Marriott sorely in need of updating.  That said, the staff were very welcoming, breakfast was great, and the artwork in the rooms (well done photos of 1970s scenes at Cal State) was cool and a bit retro.  This is an older property.  The lobby, corridors, restaurant, and rooms need to come into the 21st century.  But the great wait staff in the restaurant and behind the front desk lead to my recommendation.

This Marriott is a bit aged. The first sign is always the elevators. If they are slow with big buttons like an arcade game, you know you are in 70's territory.  My first room could get wifi reception as it was on the edge of the signal. After waiting in the lobby for 30 minutes or so, I got a replacement room which worked fine.  The hotel is very convenient to 57 and CSU, obviously that's the draw. It is clean and I always check for bed bugs. My check, which entails taking off the sheets and looking under the mattress revealed no BBs, but the mattress was clearly stained with what was either wine or blood...I'll go with wine since it helped me sleep better.  The staff is generally friendly and accommodating. Karina at the front desk was very kind. I paid $149 for a standard room

So I got on Trip Advisor after exhausting searches through Hotwire, Travelocity, Trivago, etc.  Read reviews of hotels in the Cerritos area for a Family Wedding we were attending.  Read reviews of 30 hotels in the 10 mile radius and each hotel under our price range ($100-110).  Each hotel had negative reviews of one type or another.  Sure this place had few bad ones, but after thinking about it... most of their "bad/negative" reviews seemed experienced based.  Someone's toilet not working or key card not working.  To me that just seemed like bad coincidence than bad service or hotel.  Other hotels' "Bad/Negative" reviews were more to do with how the manager just didn't treat them well or something.  SO, I decided to book my room through "Otel.com", which at the time gave us a

Very quiet place when I traveled for business. Comfortable, clean beds and a great location! Didn't have a chance to use the pool area but looked clean and inviting. The consierge level had a very nice breakfast and was always quiet. Highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Derek F,  Thank you for your review. Many of our business travelers enjoy the tranquility that our property provides.   Hopefully the next time you return, you will get the opportunity to try out our relaxing pool and spa.    “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: I have stayed here with my family many times will visiting Disneyland and Knotts.  It may not be as flashy as other Marriotts, but I think it's great, especially considering the price I once Pricelined it for $39.00 plus tax. You can't beat that.
Manager Response: Dear Shane M,  Thank you for your “suite” review. I hope you enjoyed yourself at Disneyland and Knott’s Berry Farm. I am glad that you were able to take advantage of our short proximity to both attractions.   See you back very soon!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales	 Social Media Manager

Summary: We stayed a full week here.  It was very clean and very nice. Coffee available in lobby nearly 24/7.  The pool area was clean, had nice furniture and towels available.  The parking was great - plenty of spaces and a parking garage - all free.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Sharon S,  Thank you for your review. As they say the best things in life are free, or in this our case, parking and WIFI! I’m so happy your stay was an enjoyable one, we cannot wait to welcome you back!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: Stayed a weekend here.  The hotel rooms are nice and large.  Pool is nice with the cabanas and couches in the area.  We don't have any reasons in the near future to stay in Fullerton, but would recommend this hotel if you are in that area.  Front desk girl was not the friendliest over checkout.
Manager Response: Dear JCStolz,  Thank you for your review during your weekend stay with us. I am happy to read that you had the luxury of enjoying our pool area while soaking up the California sun. I would also like to apologize on behalf of my team member, please know that we take customer service very seriously as this matter will be discussed.  Hopefully there will be another reason for you to return to Fullerton. I also appreciate any and all future recommendations to our property!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: Nice and clean. Price and value are decent, a lot of parking stalls no trouble to find the parking stall when going back to the hotel at late night, and its free. Guest WiFi accessible convenience to search before you leave.
Manager Response: Dear Hugh D,  We appreciate your short and sweet review. Many guests find the parking to be very accessible and convenient to the property. I am most confident we can expect another return from you shortly!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: The Marriott in Fullerton, while not the crown jewel of the Marriott chain, certainly rates top billing as their cultured pearl.  I always stay here when visiting relatives in the area.    A four star hotel should offer a comfortable bed, air conditioning that works, a clean room stocked with amenities you actually will use, plus a good breakfast.  The Fullerton Marriott gets my vote on all four counts.  The pool area is comfortable and an excellent place to relax at the end of a hard day.    I also really like the friendly, cooperative staff at the front desk as well as in the restaurant.  On our last stay, the hotel upgraded us to their 6th floor concierge level.  Concierge guests are given a complimentary breakfast in a private lounge which also is open during the evening for
Manager Response: Dear Jim B,  Thank you for your review on your past stay with us. We are so glad that you continue to be a loyal guest at our property. I am most glad that our amenities and our team members play a huge roll in why you continue to return.  You are absolutely correct in stating that we are a family friendly hotel. Our pool area, gift shop and distance to kid friendly attractions, make it a perfect family trip. We cannot wait to see you back very soon.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Older Hotel close to Disney & Angels Stadium
Summary: The highlight here is if you forgo room service you can either get Marriott Reward points, $5 to spend at the hotel or have a tree planted somewhere in the world.  I think this is a fantastic idea as we are so wasteful when we are in hotels, particularly with sheets and towels.  We'd never dream of using a towel once at home and then laundering it, why do it at a hotel?  And not just one towel but so many!  This is a practice that should be employed at ALL Marriotts and all hotels everywhere.  (Although, despite the practice of 'hanging up your towel' to let the service staff know not to replace it, it was still replace)  We did not get a chance to visit the pool, but did enjoy the breakfast buffet twice.  The chef cooking the omelettes, etc. was very accommodating.  Needed some

Summary Heading: Last hotel of my California trip
Summary: I was here only 1 night before the flight home. I'm not sure about the location because I have no time to look around the hotel, also no information about transportation. First impression of this hotel is not quite good because of the receptionist but the hotel is quite good. Swimming pool, hot water and free internet access in the room are advantages. The room is a little to small but the bed is big. Breakfast here is really great, their service and taste can compensate my disappointment at first.
Manager Response: Dear Poumpak,  Thank you for your review during your short trip. I am sorry that you didn’t have a good first experience upon your arrival. This is definitely not a common practice at our property. I am glad to see however, that you were able to try out some of our amenities such as the pool and our complimentary WIFI access.   We hope you for you to return that way we can make your next experience better than your last!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: The staff are amazingly courteous and helpful and the place is very clean.  I gave it 4 out of 5 because I've been to Marriotts that were newer and nicer (with microwaves and refrigerators in the rooms and fantastic complementary buffets.)  The pool/hot tub and surrounding area with couches and tables were beautiful, as was the view of the pool from the room.  The art in the rooms is strange and dated (a black and white photo/painting of a football player) but that didn't detract much from our overall experience.  The front desk and housekeeping staff treated us like royalty!
Manager Response: Dear travelling111,  Thank you for your review on your recent stay with us. It’s great to read that you are an avid Marriott guest. As I’m sure you know, Marriott’s are great for accommodating all types of travelers. For example, Residence Inn’s gear towards extended stay, this is why they have full kitchens and a full buffet breakfast in the morning. Full service Marriott’s, like ours, cater to the business traveler, this is why we provide large meeting space, free WIFI and an onsite bar and restaurant.  The best part of Marriott hotels is that regardless of what Marriott you stay at, you will always be “treated like royalty”!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: This is clearly an older Marriott, but you can tell they're still working to make it the best it can be. It's in a great location adjacent to CSU Fullerton and Hope International Univerisity, and just minutes from Disneyland. Free parking and WiFi, which is a huge plus. It's a bit of a walk from the parking garage to the front desk, but not too bad.  The rooms could use some updating, but they're fine. A bigger priority should be the carpets in the hallways, which probably should've been replaced years ago. Overall, though, it's a clean hotel with a great staff. Every staff member we dealt with was universally friendly and helpful.  You could stay closer to Disneyland and pay for parking and WiFi, but this Marriott is a definitely a viable alternative. Overall, a good value in a
Manager Response: Dear 56waldorf,  I sincerely appreciate such a wonderful review. You are absolutely correct in saying that we always work to make our hotel “the best it can be”. With that said, I will make sure to bring the carpeting up in our next staff meeting.   Our location is conveniently within shopping and dining. We also are only a short distance to attractions such as Disneyland and Knott’s Berry Farm.   Give us a call the next time you decide to come down so we can help plan your trip!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Exactly What I Expected and Needed.
Summary: I traveled down to watch my alma mater play in the NCAA Super Regional baseball tournament.  The outcome was disappointing, but not my stay.  The staff was welcoming, the room was clean and tidy and the service was warm but not overly effusive.  It is hard to make a short term single traveler feel welcome but this location did an excellent job.  I will return to this hotel again in the future, hopefully to see my Titans win again soon.
Manager Response: Dear beagle47,  Thank you for an amazing review and I am so sorry to hear about the tournament outcome. It makes me so proud to read that our team went above and beyond your expectations to make you feel welcome. Guest service is something the team holds to a high standard and we are glad that it showed.  See you in the future for the next game, go Titans!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: I stayed here for 1night. Room was little old but comfort and cozy to sleep...  quiet as well my room was in top floor though. They also have a club lounge and self parking structure(Free). This was the only Marriott hotel doesn't charge parking fee. Good hotel for 1night biz staying.
Manager Response: Dear jayk333,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to read you had an enjoyable stay during your business trip. I like to highlight one great amenity that we offer: free parking. I am happy to see that it was very convenient for you during your stay.  We hope to see you back soon!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: I have been to this hotel many times.  We seem to have all of our work meetings at this hotel.  I would say this hotel is average.  In my opinion it needs to be updated.  The carpet in the hallways is worn and dingy.  The rooms are so-so.  I will say the staff is always friendly.  If I didn't have to stay here for work, I would probably search out other hotels in the area.
Manager Response: Dear BeckiandJames,  I appreciate your review whilst here on business. I apologize that our rooms have not had the ability to exceed your expectations . Rest assured that we will be experiencing major renovations very shortly. Needless to say, I am so proud that the team never fails to accommodate you when you stay.   We would love to see you back not just for business but for a leisure trip as well. Please contact us if you have any further questions or concerns.  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales	 Social Media Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a night while in the area on business.  King room was $170 per night.  Good location right off the 57 freeway.  It is basically right on the Cal State Fullerton Campus.  Decent size pool and hottub outside.  The bar/restaurant is an Irish Pub theme and the food was pretty good for dinner.  Breakfast was also above average.  I'd stay again if I needed to be in that area.
Manager Response: Dear RobScott1975,  I am so glad this stay was more than convenient for your business trip. I am happy to see that you took a break from work to enjoy our outdoor pool and hot tub. Hopefully the next time that you return it will be for leisure trip.  Thank you again!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: Wife and I stayed in a King bedroom. Bed was so comfortable! Flat screen tv with a gazillion channels! Everything was very clean! Close to tons of food/shopping just a few blocks down Nutwood and around the corner. Close to Disneyland too, and a freeway right nearby for easy access to anywhere. In the morning (maybe all the time for the water?) this hotel had fresh water in the lobby with watermelon in it to give it a cool-down melony taste, and free coffee in the lobby too in the morning! TIP: Recommend eat breakfast across the street at Jay's cafe for great homemade waffles with up to 25 toppings at no  extra charge, tons of fresh fruit toppings, for $4.44.
Manager Response: Dear bobbyfranky,  Thank you for such a wonderful review. I also appreciate all of your future recommendations. You are correct; there are so many shopping and dining options within only a five minute drive from us. The Brea Mall offers stores such as: Nordstroms, Macy’s, Forever 21 and restaurants such as the Cheesecake Factory, BJ’s Restaurant Brewhouse and many more! And with the freeway so close to us, it makes the trip just as convenient!   Come back soon to check out the rest of our “gazillion” channels!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful! Everyone went beyond the call of duty, especially jasmine on the front desk and Howard the assistant manager. I can't
Summary: Everyone went beyond the call of duty, especially Howard, the assistant manager,and jasmine were very helpful. I can't walk very good and between the two of them they got the shuttle for me to go to my granddaughters Masters graduation,something I didn't want to miss act, everyone from the desk clerk to the waiters and waitresses were very nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear CJanh,  Wow, I cannot be more proud of the team for going above and beyond! Thank you so much for sharing your stay with all of us. We definitely will acknowledge Howard and Jasmine on their excellent customer service.   I hope your granddaughters graduation went well and send her a big CONGRATS from everyone at the property!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: I was traveling for a business trip.  The hotel is located right of interstate @ edge of Cal State Fullerton campus.  Rooms were clean, lobby is very bright & clean.  Restaurant was on site & had breakfast there each day.  Food was good & reasonable.    Only problem I had was it took the water in my shower a few minutes to warm up.  I informed the hotel manager about it & he has taken steps to fix the problem  I would recommend this property especially if you are traveling on business.
Manager Response: Dear kmacw3kids,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay at our property. I absolutely agree when you mention that our property is perfect for traveling on business. With our meeting space and complimentary WIFI, it provides a perfect atmosphere for our business guests.   I am sorry you experienced a minor issue during your stay. I am so glad that management took action and resolved the issue for you.  Thank you again for your review and don’t hesitate to contact our sales team for your next business trip!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: If you are doing anything at the Fullerton campus, this is where you want to stay. It's on-campus and within a few walking minutes to the dorms. It's a lovely hotel with modern furnishings. The rooms were comfortable and spacious. Internet has a fee unless you are a member of their rewards program. The restaurant and bar downstairs are well-designed. It was a nice place to sit and enjoy a drink. While you can walk to nearby restaurants and Target, it is not convenient. It's best to drive and the parking is free. Everything is an easy drive as the interstate is right there.
Manager Response: Dear polarspeech,  Thank you for your awesome response. You are absolutely correct in stating that we are convenient and close to Cal State University of Fullerton, in fact, we are right across the street.   Our Irish themed pub is the perfect place for a drink. Being that we also serve breakfast, lunch and dinner, it’s a convenient bite to eat as well!   “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: As an annual participant in the Donate Life run/walk I Love staying here each year. Front desk has always been stellar in distance and very knowledgeable. Only one minor item, I would like a small fridge in the rooms.
Manager Response: Dear John J  Wow! That is so amazing to read that you participated in the “Donate Life Run/Walk”. We are grateful that you continue to choose our hotel as your home during this time.   As for your request, I will be sure to bring this up to our superiors! Hope to see you back before the next run/walk!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel through priceline and one thing I would let everyone to be made aware is that when you book this hotel through priceline, breakfast is not included and if you wish to have breakfast they charge $14 per head for breaskfast which is served as a buffet. I agreet  witht he review that the room is noisy but the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable to sleep in. There were ample restaurants in the vicinity and there a few a restaurants right opposite to where the hotel is located. We did not realize that they charge $2 for the water bottle that is placed along with the coffee. Parking is very close to the hotel and he hotel staff is very courteous and always smiling. The hotel is about 10 miles from disneyland. There is no fridge nor a microwave in the room
Manager Response: Dear Faisal N,  I appreciate your very informative review. Thank you for making our future guests aware of some of our fees. The onsite restaurant that provides breakfast, lunch, and dinner provides convenience for guests traveling at all hours.   I am so glad to read that the team provided the upmost excellent service. We always strive to make sure our guests leave more than satisfied!  “Suite” Regards  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: My company moved our corporate stay program over to the Fullerton Marriott in 2012. I find myself more relaxed and at ease after working during my travels since we made this move. The rooms have good space, the bedding very comfortable and the shower and amenities ideal for someone who travels frequently.  More recently, I find myself enjoying their restaurant more frequently. It is a nice relaxing environment overall. The breakfast buffet is as good as any that I have encountered during my travels, with nice fast service for any special needs.
Manager Response: Dear Richard H,  Thank you so much for your sincere review. I am so glad to read that your stay made you feel “relaxed and at ease”. After all, those are most important when traveling. I am also happy to read that you enjoyed the delicious food at our restaurant. This can be extremely convenient if you prefer not to leave the premises. Our Irish themed pub is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner so you can satisfy all of your taste buds!  See you very soon!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: Very friendly staff, usual fairly large rooms. There is some noise from nearby freeway. The I house Ha penny pub/restaurant has above average food at reasonable prices. The pool while not large is very pleasant and pool side food is good.
Manager Response: Dear YpsilantiFoodie,  Thank you for your review on our hotel. I am sorry you experienced some of the road noise on your trip. Please feel free to contact any one of our team members at the property when planning your next trip and we will do all we can to get you a nice quiet room away from the road!  Hope to see you back very soon.  “Suite” Regards  Kimberly Rosales Hotel Management Respondent

Summary Heading: Old, loud and not close to anything other than the University
Summary: I am sitting in the hotel right now.  In an "elite" room.  I can hear someone in the room above me peeing and then flushing.  I can hear kids crying at the pool and the food is overpriced and crappy.  I'm only staying here because it was the conference hotel for an event I'm attending.  The staff is nice.  The hotel is dated and very poorly sound-proofed.  I can hear the people and toilets/showers from above, below and each side.  Don't stay here unless you have to.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay.  I appreciate your feedback as this is one of the best tools I have to gage how we are doing and make the appropriate changes when necessary.    I agree that the staff is nice as we continue to receive guest praises for their friendliness and professionalism.   I will share your experience with the team and I will also work with our culinary crew to assure the food quality levels are up to standards.   Thank you again for taking the time to voice your concerns and allow us the opportunity to grow as hospitality professionals. Warm regards, MFGM

Summary: The Mariott Fullerton is very convenient to the campus  - right across the street  - and is easlsily accessible from the freeway. The desk staff were helpful and efficient. The parking was very good, no additional charges and very convenient.  We found the Bar a good place for a drink and the staff was friendly. We did not try the resturant - colleagues had suggested the food was dissapointing. We did use the Concierge level lounge for breakfast. Great view. The food was fresh and there was a staff person who assure all was in good order.  Our rooms were pleasant but awkwardly shaped. The overall facility was well decorated, pleasant and clean but becoming worn. The lobby restrooms smelled as if there were plumbing problems.

Great location. We initially stayed at this property as it was the team hotel for a hockey tournament. They were very friendly to us and the team as a whole. We stayed an additional night and went to DisneyLand. It was very close to Disney and hotel is in a decent part of Anaheim/Fullerton- close to shopping, food, etc... The staff was nice and our room was cleaned promptly every day. The restaurant service was slow, but that's the only complaint I can think of.

All associates go the extra mile to ensure guest satisfaction.  Had a room by the pool with a nice patio.  Undersized room, but well appointed, and very clean with a great, comfortable bed, workstation, and sitting area.  Slow wi-fi but free, free parking. Concierge Lounge was worth the nominal cost and everyone was very kind and helpful.  Pool and hot tub area are comfortable and have plenty of seating areas around the pool.  Nice older property.  The buffet breakfast was excellent with omelets made to order and fresh squeezed orange juice, applewood smoked bacon, waffles, cereals, fruit, pastries, yogurt, more.  Really great stay!

We needed a place to stay in Fullerton for one night. We stayed a the Fullerton Marriott using points. It was very nice. Check in was swift and friendly. We were there on a quiet night. We took the bus right out front to downtown Fullerton which is full of restaurants and bars. I grew up in Fullerton many years ago so it was a surreal experience. I would stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: An older hotel, but in great shape.
Summary: Stayed here for a night on business.  It's an older hotel that had me a bit scared as to what the rooms may be like, but fear not, they're in good shape!  Pros ------ -Clean, well kept room -Free parking -Free WiFi (see cons below) -Nice flat screen TV with lots of HD channels -Friendly staff -Nice pool and hot tub area -Very quiet  Cons ------ -WiFi speeds so slow that I couldn't do a speed test -Room layout in the King room I was in is a bit odd -Older style, slightly noisy HVAC setup

Summary Heading: Great Stay at the Fullerton Marriott!
Summary: The staff and manager always go the extra mile to make sure you're taken care of, and the location is excellent. I've stayed at this Marriott several times and always get a good nights sleep! The room is great, and the bed is beyond comfortable. I also enjoy Starbucks coffee in the morning. It's the perfect place to stay when traveling on business, and to see family, friends or tour the area. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Fullerton.

The location is easy access off CA57.  Easy parking in covered garage.  Front desk staff very friendly, helpful and accomodating.   Rooms are pretty typical, decorated in bright colors - look like the website photos.  Bathroom amenities are nice and room clean.  The hotel restaurant has a Irish theme - food was mediocre at best, but servers were attentive.

Older hotel but clean. Staff very friendly and helpful.Restaurant was done up in an Irish pub theme and looked very realistic. Only ate breakfast in the restaurant. Only ate from the buffet becasue of the deal we had with the tournament. It had very reasonable choices; egg station, meats, waffles, french toast, breads, fruits. Very freeway accessible.

My Husband and I went to this hotel for a short stay. Very nice front desk and staff. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished,kind of small. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood and there are some restaurants right across the street. All in all, if I had to be in Fullerton again, I'd stay here!

Check in was nice and fast. Room was clean and had a nice view. The atmosphere of the dining room was very cute. Pool was a  disappointment. Was too cold for the kids (which means it really has to be cold) Also there was a whole corner dedicated to a sports teams equipment. The equipment didn't bother us but I could see how easy it would have been for someone to mess with it. I would stay here again but would hope the pool would be a bit warmer. Also  very quiet.

We continue to stay here on our visits to the area, and most recently in February 2013.  Staff at this property continues to be top-notch!  They are always friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  Some even recognize me and address me by my name.  Check-in went smoothly and when I asked about breakfast coupons for the weekend (I'm Platinum Premier in the Marriott Rewards program), they were promptly filled out and given to me.  I was told that my special requests were in my room, my choice of newspaper was confirmed, and I was offered my Platinum arrival gift.  Our room was on the concierge, sixth, floor and yes, the rooms are a bit on the small side, but we don't spend a lot of time in the room.  It's the standard Marriott room with a desk, small sofa, and flat screen tv.  There

This "old style" hotel reminds me of a New York hotel. The facility has a lot of amenities, and the regular guest rooms are small and cramped.  I felt claustraphobic in the room.  With a small room, why does the bed have three giant decorative pillows?  Where do you put the pillows when you take them off the bed?  Why is the desk taking up space when it could be against the wall?  The room had an odd configuration was was not efficient on usage of space. Almost no surface space to put anything.  You have the choice of a comforter that made you too hot, or just the sheet (that made you too cold).  Though there is free wifi, the office center computer charges 50 cents per minute for internet for those without a wifi device.  Local phone calls are $1.00 per minute for those without

Summary Heading: Old and tired with poor customer service
Summary: Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly. The parking was free. Unfortunately, that is where the list of positives ends.  The skylights in the lobby are cracked, and have been repaired (badly) with tape. Great first impression.  An advance request for connecting rooms was ignored. Assigned rooms had musty smell with chipped bathroom sink. Old, tired walls, artwork, and drapes make for a depressing appearance.  The concierge lounge is a tiny, poorly maintained space that served a warmed-over continental breakfast with minimal offerings. Lounge attendant was noisy and rude.  Internet connection was slow and inconsistent. Received some Marriott Rewards points as an apology, along with a series of lame excuses for the problem.  Our treatment was so poor that we cancelled our second
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write about your experience.  It is feedback like yours that provides us the opportunity to make the appropriate and necessary adjustments to our performance enabling us to provide all of our guests with a restful and relaxing experience. I appreciate your candor and would ask the Trip Advisor users to look at the pages of positive reviews that have been given to our location.  I understand that you didn’t have a particularly enjoyable visit but honestly can't see why this has created such a harsh response.   This type of experience and reaction isn’t typical of our property which the countless other reviews attest to.  Rest assured that I have shared your feedback with the team and all have taken this guest service failure to heart as we take pride in what we do and go out of our way to take care of our guests.     Thank you again for providing us with your feedback, allowing us the opportunity to learn and grow as hospitality professionals and assure this hotel remains one of the best Marriott Hotels in the country.  Warm regards,  Brian Murphy  General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel, small reception area, room not vaccumed daily, n sheets not changed when there is food stain, jacuzzi warm n nice in the cold weather, central location, got great deal via priceline, lots of restaurants within driving distance.

Well, there are nice things about this hotel.  The service is good and the staff responsive.  I'm a Platinum member with 3 years of nights in Marriott hotels so I know the chain very well.  This location does not fare well when compared with most other full-service Marriotts.  The beds are not the new, more comfortable version but just ok.  The air conditioning at night drove me crazy.  It was so loud and for some reason when it kicks in it smacks you right in the face while in bed.  And on the concierge lounge the wi-fi is really, really slow.  Finally I try not to eat at the restaurant in the lobby. Again, not terrible but its one of those "Irish" bars you find in the US.  When I pointed out the restaurant to my colleague she asked, "is that the kind of Irish bar where they

Summary Heading: Nice hotel on state university campus.
Summary: Nice hotel, everything as expected and there are plenty of restaurants around to eat. Inside the college campus that kids also took a tour to see the real orange fruit tree.   We had a great time there.

Summary Heading: Comfortable beds and a great weekend breakfast
Summary: I stayed a weekend over at the Fullerton Marriott, and it was a wonderful stay.  The room was clean, as expected from a Marriott hotel.  The beds were very comfortable, a significant difference compared to most other hotels.  The concierge lounge had a good amount of snacks, fruit, soda, and water available.  Not to mention it was a great deal for the amount of Marriott points being spent per night.  In addition, the front desk staff was very accomodating, and made sure all needs were taken care of during the stay.  A breakfast buffet was provided on the weekend (as a Platinum Marriott member), and it had a large variety of items available.  Fullerton Marriott is definitely a place I would stay again the next time I'm in the area.

This was a very clean room, albeit somewhat small. Three people in a double double, and we had difficulty getting around each other. It wasn't a huge problem for our one-night stay, but any lengthy stay would probably be difficult. The room was very clean and the bathroom was decorated nicely.  Beds were amazingly comfortable. The lighting needs some work... I'm all for going green with compact flourescent, but the entire room had 2 small lamps and each bed had a reading light. There was an entry light by the door, but the room is configured such that there is a wall blocking most of that light. I have good eyes and I would have had trouble doing any actual work if I needed to get something done.   Overall, nice for the deal that I snagged. Not sure if I had stayed longer if I

Usually, you know what you're going to get from a Marriott property, which is why I chose to stay here over some of the other hotels in the area. However, this property was very disappointing for a Marriott. It's definitely outdated, which I could forgive if it was at least clean. The walls were all smudged and not just from luggage, some of it looked like food and makeup debris (at least I hope that's what it was!) There were grease marks all over the desk and guest book and the mirrors hadn't been wiped down either. Maybe there are nicer rooms than mine in this hotel because my bed certainly didn't have a pillow top mattress or nice pillows like I read in some other reviews. The worst though was in the morning when I pulled the shower curtain back and saw mold covering the
