I appreciate the feedback as this is a valuable tool that myself and the team use to help discover our service failures and operational challenges and fix them so they don’t recur.  I appreciate your candor and would ask the Trip Advisor users to look at the pages of positive reviews that have been given to our location.  I understand that you didn’t have a particularly enjoyable visit and will share this with the team as this type of experience isn’t typical of our property which the countless other reviews attest to.     Thank you again for providing us with your feedback, allowing us the opportunity to learn and grow as hospitality professionals and assure this hotel remains one of the best Marriott Hotels in the country.  Warm regards,  Brian Murphy  General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel through my hotel tonight app and was able to get this room at a decent price! We were placed on the third floor which smelled a little funky but the smell however did not travel into our room. This hotel is at a great location located right next to the freeway with easy access and exit. There is plenty of parking which makes it super easy to not worry about any car dings. Beds are comfortable and offer plenty of plush pillows
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire team here at the Marriott Fullerton I would like to thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write about your positive experience with us.  We all take great pride in providing a restful and refreshing stay and we appreciate your kind words.  Thank you and have a wonderful new year!!  Brian Murphy General Manager

Summary: I had a great stay at The Fullerton marriott. The room was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly. I had a chance to visit the concierge lounge and the ladies working in the lounge in the evening on 11/28 and the morning on 11/29 work very friendly and helpful. The hotel was also in a great location. Will be back.
Manager Response: Dear Arizona Tony, Thank you for taking the time to let me know about your stay.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay and will share your review with the team. Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you back again soon.  Brian Murphy General Manager

Summary: Have stayed here on numerous occasions,and have always felt special to the staff. The General Manager pays attention to details and is aware of periodic miscues that can occur on any property.  He is quick to make amends.  This facility is certainly worthy of the Marriott name.  Would not think of staying anywhere else when in this area

From the moment I walked into the lobby this was a good stay. Greeted warmly by the man behind the desk, no problems checking in and because I am a silver Marriot member he gave me two drink coupons for the bar. Used them after dropping stuff off in the room. Great bar service, cozy atmosphere. Nice calamari appetizer and flatbread pizza hit the spot.  The room was just the right size for the two of us. The bed was very comfortable with the pillow top and soft sheets. The room was very clean. The pool was clean too and just warm enough to swim in for morning exercise. I really liked this hotel!

I always have a great stay when I travel here while on business. The staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel is conveniently located near restaurants and highways. The pancakes are a terrific choice for breakfast. It is a great choice if you have an event to attend on the California State Fullerton Campus.

I stay at this Marriott which is near my home when I'm "on retreat".  (I'm a mother of four and sometimes need a break!)   Sometimes my husband and I also stay here when we have a "date weekend" together.  I have always been very happy with the staff, service, and rooms.  My one complaint is that the upper windows tend to look out over the a/c units on the roof, but it is southern california and crowded, so that probably isn't really something they can fix.  My rooms have always been very clean, the maids are accommodating and do a great job, and I always enjoy my stay.

Summary Heading: Full Marriott Level Property with nice rooms and reasonable price...
Summary: Rented 2 rooms with family in July 2012.  Building a little dated but rooms / beds were very good.  The property had an okay pool.  The property is south east of Los Angeles so great to use as a base to access attractions in this area (Disney World, Manhattan Beach, Long Beach...).  What I really liked is that it is a full Marriott property at discount hotel price (priced like 2 or 3 star property in the area but more it is a 4 star property)...  So, good value...

Summary Heading: Short Drive to Attractions in Area
Summary: We booked online and found a great deal on this hotel.  We were given a corner room which was larger than the norm.  Close to freeway so short drive to Disneyland, Knott's, etc.  Great location if you are visiting someone at the college that is across the street.  Had a housekeeping problem (no coffee for two days, no clean glasses) but contacted Front Desk and it was rectified.  We had two beds but they were more full size than queen size.  Other than that the room was clean and comfortable for a family of three.

Summary Heading: Am a platinum premier member and this property was average
Summary: When I checked in I was at the Elite Check in line and there were two people behind the front desk.  One was helping someone to review a discrepancy on the bill and the other was giving directions.  Then the people were gone.  I was there alone and the attendants then were attending to phone calls.  It took 15 minutes literally for me to check in.  The room was clean and attended to daily.  The food in the Concierge Lounge was average but the people attending the lounge were exceptional.  The day I checked out the people behind the desk were very courteous.  The only other problem I experienced there was the TV didn't work well

Summary Heading: The Worst Marriott Property we've ever been to
Summary: Could not echo more from the last comment.  I am writing this review from my room at Fullerton Marriott.  - Staffs do their jobs at minimum barebone, but no customer care.  I was told that the lounge is closed during the weekend and no other remedies (breakfast voucher) will be provided.  I called up from my room to see if I can have a bottle of water in lieu of what I should have grabbed from the lounge.  I was told by frontdesk to come down and get one.  Why didn't he just offer one when he told me about this situation at check in??? - Internet connection is extremely slow and will be up and down every minute.  I am currently using the guest connection from CSU.  What a shame to the hotel! - A/C is so loud and has a wide swing of temperature.    This hotel experience will
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest, Thank you for taking the time to voice your very relevant and sincere concerns.   I completely understand your heartfelt disappointment and as I mentioned in our e-mail exchange, I do wish that this was escalated to me immediately so I could have resolved this allowing you and your family to enjoy your stay with us.   As a full service Marriott Hotel we are required to follow brand standards as this is the directive given to us by Marriott corporate and currently the brand standard is to offer complimentary continental breakfast during scheduled concierge lounge hours Monday thru Friday only.   I do understand that there are hotels that violate this standard which causes inconsistencies in guest expectations.   My apologies for the inconsistencies you have experienced.  Rest assured I have reviewed your comments with the entire team to assure that everyone completely understands our policies and how to go about making exceptions when they are warranted.  Warm regards,  Brian Murphy General Manger

Summary: I am a loyal customer of the Marriott, I often travel for business and pleasure and have been staying with your hotel for years. My family and I were planning for a relaxing weekend at the Marriott.  We made reservations in advance, planning for a weekend of fun and relaxation. Upon on arrival, we were denied our room for the weekend and learned that our reservation was given up. With no apologies, Due to the change in location, we were unable to attend several of events for which we planned our visit. This resulted in changes to our vacation agenda and compromising comfort.  Stay away from this hotel
Manager Response: Dear Gentle Person, I would like to thank you for taking the time to write about your experience.   I appreciate your candor.   I see that you never actually stayed at our property being turned away due to a reservation error.  I understand how frustrating that could be and offer you my sincere apology for the inconvenience.  I would respectfully ask the Trip Advisor users to look at the pages of positive reviews that have been given to our location.    Thank you again for providing us with your feedback, allowing us the opportunity to learn and grow as hospitality professionals and assure this hotel remains one of the best Marriott Hotels in the country.  Warm regards,  Brian Murphy  General Manager

Summary: Everything was easy -- checkin, parking, checkout.  Entire staff was warm and friendly.  Room was great, bathroom clean, amenities sufficient.  Bed was sooo comfortable that I want to buy the comforter but I dont know which one was on the bed!! Free internet was a plus as was the loction close to freeway access.  Only downside was service at the Starbucks area in the bar.  It took almost 10 minutes to get waited on which was not ok for my busy morning.

We spent 2 nights at the Fullerton Marriott. It is a comfortable hotel right next to the CSUF campus. The staff was quite good and the rooms and public areas very clean. The bed is very good. We didn't eat there, so I cannot assess the restaurant. The hotel is adjacent to a major freeway and has plenty of complimentary parking for guests. i would recommend this hotel especially for those looking for one in Northern Orange County close to the university and, perhaps, Knott's Berry Farm.

We stayed at this hotel for one night to attend an event in the area.  We were fortunate to get a great rate through hotel tonight(great app). This property has free parking and free Internet.  We were close to many restaurants and activities.  Check in and check out was quick and easy.  The room was very clean and comfortable and we would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Service, Good Location, Excellent Beds
Summary: I stayed four nights at this property in September 2012.  I paid $119.00 per night.  The hotel staff was great – well trained, responsive and positive.    There was plenty of parking.  Both valet and self-parking are available and the self-park is in close proximity to the front door of the hotel.     The beds were super comfy and I highly recommend them.  The rooms are standard Marriott in layout and décor – nicely appointed and set up to address both casual and business travelers’ needs.  The TV channel options were more divers than Marriott’s normally offer, which was nice, as I had a lot of ‘down-time’.    I did not visit the pool but could see if from my room.  It looked adequate and included a hot tub.    I ordered room service several times.  Note room service ends at

The Marriott at the Fullerton, CA campus is extremely well run.  The food was excellent and above all the hospitality was as good as I have experienced in my travels.  I will for sure stay there again on my business travels and would strongly recommend it to anyone as a high quality place to stay.

I moved my daughter in her dorm and i wanted a place to stay close by so i could be there for her the next day, she ended up staying with me because her roomate had not moved in yet so we had a great stay the bed was super comfortable we ordered room service and it was from the fit menu it was delicious and the staff was super friendly will be planning on visiting my baby girl often so i will definitly stay here again and again!!!

Summary Heading: Do not eat at Ha' Penny Pub as employee's are rude
Summary: The Marriott was pretty good however Ha' Penny Pub employee's where rude to my child and myself.   Our hockey team was staying over labor day weekend and on the first morning at the breakfeast two other kids joined us at our table and the one next to it.  Our server told the children they where not allowed to sit at that table as it was not to be used and the child should go back to his seat.  Then she changed the bill from 7.xx to 10.x for my sons breakfast buffet after already giving me the bill for 7xx and she was kind of cranky.  That night after returning from a hockey game we where told we could not sit at the middle table as it was reserved and the next table we tried to sit was reservered too.... at this point I said this was BS I would no longer be eating at the Ha'
Manager Response: Dear jschuepb, Thank you for taking the time to let me know about your stay.  I appreciate the feedback as this is a valuable tool that myself and the team use to help discover our service failures and operational challenges and fix them so they don’t recur. I am glad that Tany was able to wow you over at the pool with his famous nachos.  He is the “Mr. Mustache” you referred to and truly exemplifies Marriott’s spirit to serve. I have shared your breakfast and evening experience with the restaurant and lounge team and I am personally working with them to bring their service levels up to standards. Please accept my sincere apology and thank you for staying with us.  Brian Murphy General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, for a fair price
Summary: This hotel is located 10 minutes from Disneyland and at half the price of the Anaheim hotels. It is also located near the Nixon Museum. The front desk staff were among the nicest people I met during my vacation thru California. Any question was answered and always to my satisfaction. The room is both clean and nicely furnished. The hotel is located next to the Cal State campus, so their is a large variety of restaurants and stores if you need anything.

Hotel was just okay, it's right next door to Cal State Fullerton, which is super convenient if you need to go there. Furnishings are starting to look like they could use a refresh in the room. Room service was EXCELLENT though. Vending machine on 3rd floor not working and when I went to the hotel store to get a bottle of water and told them it was broken I had to pay the store price which was more than the vending machine price (kind of lame).
Manager Response: Dear valued guest, I would first like to thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience here at the Fullerton Marriott.  I will share your room service praises with the team as they really do go the extra mile assuring all of our guests are well taken care of.  My apologies for the vending machine problem.  This is a great learning moment for the front desk team as they should have just matched the vending machine price for you.  Please accept my sincere apologies for this mis-step.   Also, we are coming up on a refresh of our rooms and in the interim we are conducting intense professional deep cleans of our rooms.   Thank you again for sharing your experience with us and we hope to see you back again soon.  Brian Murphy General Manager

Summary: Outstanding hotel within walking distance of Cal State Fullerton. Easy  access from 57 Freeway. Nice concierge lounge, nicely appointed fitness center. Good places to eat within walking distance. Easy drive to Angels Stadium. We will definitely stay at this property again.

Summary Heading: A clean, average overnight stay for work.
Summary: I have stayed at most of the hotels in this area for work and this is my second favorite. Rooms were clean, service was good, but nothing was very impressive. For the price, there are other hotels in the area that go the extra mile. I do however use this hotel when booking rooms for my company employees. I like that the brand is well known and my employees are comfortable and know what to expect.

Summary Heading: Good Stay.  Easy Access.  Good Price
Summary: Spent one night on business at this hotel.  Very easy to access hotel; right at the entrance/exit ramp of CA-57.   Parking at the hotel is free; parking lot and a parking garage available for parking.     Room was comfortable and good sized.  King sized bed, flat screen TV, work desk and comfortable desk chair.  Bathroom contained toilet and shower while sink with good-sized counter was outside.  Bed was comfortable and made for a good night's sleep.  Though close to the highway, it was very quiet and did not hear any road noise in the room.  Everything was is good working order and room was clean.    For food, the hotel has a very large restaurant in the lobby;  room service is also available.  Across the street there were a few options to eat at that would not require one to

Summary Heading: Below Marriott standard but still a decent place
Summary: My best guess is that this hotel was not originally a Marriott or the physical facility is just aging a bit.  The staff and many amenities were consistent with Marriott quality.  The guest floor hallways are just a bit dingy, in need of updating.  The guest room floor plan is pretty dopey, with there being no straight path from the bedroom to the bathroom.  My first night I tried to navigate this path in the dark room and hit my head on a wall that extends where logic defies.  Climate control units are mounted in the wall, just like at Motel 6.  The thermostats are better but that does not modify your choice of being far from the vent or having it blow directly on you.  Business center charges a $5 minimum.  That is pricey if you just need to print out a single page, such as a
Manager Response: Dear valued guest, Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay.   I appreciate your feedback as this is a perfect outlet for us to gage how we are performing. I am glad you had the opportunity to enjoy the food and beverage outlets.  Our culinary and service team takes pride in their work and genuinely cares about providing a wonderful dining experience for all of our guests.    The hotel originally opened as a Marriott and several other Marriott hotels throughout the chain have the same floor plan and configuration.    You may have had a corner room where there is a long hallway that is somewhat different from the conventional hotel room which may have seemed a bit odd.    I appreciate your feedback on our climate control system.   Our hotel was built with individual A/C units placed in the lower walls in each room rather than a central air system piping air into each room through a series of vents.    Some folks like a central air system while others prefer the individual units.  I like the benefit of being able to service or replace a single unit rather than have the entire unit serviced creating gaps in service throughout the hotel during maintenance periods. Finally we have a boarding pass printer adjacent to the front desk that is complimentary and also offer complimentary boarding pass printing in our business center as well.     Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you back again soon.  Brian Murphy General Manager

Summary: After a long day at Disney, we checked into the Marriot.  The concierge was very nice and professional.  The room was clean and comfortable.  At the fullerton Marriot, you are within walking distance to a burger place, a cantina, and a coffee shop.  I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to my friends and family.  My only suggestion for Marriot would be a better beer selection and irish food fare in their Irish Pub., that way you don't need to walk across the street.  =)

We stayed two nights here while visiting Knottsberry Farm.  Very nice, clean and comfortable rooms.  Nice outside pool, hot tub and work out room.  We were invited to the Concierge Room for dinner and breakfast during our stay....This was totally unexpected and was an awesome surprise!!  We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

We booked this property at the last minute for a Disneyland vacation with our grand children. We were very impressed with your staff from the front desk, club level and maids! Every employee we came in contact with made our stay a very memorable vacation. Our room was very clean and had all the amenities and more. We will definatley recommend this hotel to our family and freinds and look forward to our next stay at this fine hotel. Thanks Marriott Fullerton!

My husband & I stay here several times a year while visiting family in the area. It is consistently quiet, clean, and we love the soft linens!  The location is convenient, the staff friendly and helpful.

Stayed here for only a night with family so that we can catch an early flight at LAX.  Location was good as there were many restaurants and attractions nearby.  The staff was nice and friendly.  We needed a rollaway and it came pretty quick.  There were many "young people" around but I'm guessing it's because it's near the university.  It makes a great stop to just sleep but probably not to "lounge" around.  Recommend!

Summary Heading: Old hotel but good price and location
Summary: Stayed here for one night in June, hotel is old but clean and had plenty of parking spaces. The lady who checked me in at the Elite counter was inexperienced and not up to Marriott customer service level, But the Gentleman at the next counter was excellent and helped me get a quieter room away from the noise. I paid for a deluxe room but the room I got looked like an normal room, no cotton buds, shoe wipes etc. Every Marriott Deluxe room I stayed had cotton buds, shoe wipes etc..in the room. The location of the hotel and the price for the area are great. They also gave me access to the lounge, which was nice on their part ( I am only a Silver member), but the lounge is very small and did not have much stuff but since I got free access I can't complain. Overall it's a OK hotel

The hotel is everything you would expect for the price. The university is literally the view and gives an excellent vibe to the hotel. The staff is professional and courteous, the pool very nice for a quick dip.  This is not a resort this is a hotel with a elegantish look and feel to it in a suburb close to world type attractions like Disneyland. I am a local a csuf alumni and found this hotel excellent for a local night away from home.  The in hotel pub had a weekend special for Sara and pizza for 15 dollars which made the stay even better

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the property!  All staff members we encountered were friendly, always accommodating and helpful.  The location was perfect; close to the highway, stores, gas stations, etc...Upon arrival, the room was very clean and it was a nice touch to have the $5/day offer allowing us to utilize the coupon towards restaurant purchases in lieu of having our room cleaned each day!  Towels were always readily available for us and the property offers several quiet areas to retreat to!  This property was a great value; would definitely return!

Summary Heading: Poor accommodatioms for a very important trip for me
Summary: Was told by a group sales rep that I could get an early check in...that did not happen ...had to go straight to my event after driving 4 and a half hours and did not return until late night and rollaway bed was not in my room ....I was only there for a night and accommations for me were poor.....continental breakfast was good though

Summary Heading: Annual place to stay for US National racquetball singles championship
Summary: Great location, easy to get in and out of, plenty of restaurants and places to shop nearby.  Facilities are well maintained, very nice lobby, nice poool and hot tub.  Self parking easy and plentiful.  I prefer the ground floor rooms.  Rooms are ok.  They have all you need, maybe need some updating.  Staff is very friendly, helpfull and professional.  Stayed here twice and will stay again.

I often stay here because it's very convenient when I'm visiting family and the rates are usually reasonable. The last two times I've stayed here (in May 2012) I've noticed that the rooms are not as clean as they used to be. The chairs and ottomans are stained and so are the pillows on those chairs.  I would love to relax and sit in them, but those stains are a real turn-off.  I also once found a hair on the pillow and a bed that did not look freshly made as well as again, stains on the chair.  I was given a different room which also had a stained chair. So, on 2 stays, every one of the three rooms I was in had stained furniture. When I mentioned it to the staff, they said, "well, we are going to update the furniture". I think that's fine, but in the meantime, they need to clean
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest, I first would like to thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay.  I appreciate the recognition given to the front desk team.  They are truly professional, friendly and genuinely concerned about each and every one of our guests stays.    I apologize for the stains on the chairs.  We just recently had all of our room’s furniture, carpet and drapes professionally deep cleaned while we are waiting for our new chairs to arrive.   We hope to have those replaced in short order. Thank you again for taking the time to provide us with this important feedback.  We thrive on receiving guest comments and taking immediate action as we continue to make this hotel a great place for all of our guests to enjoy.  Warm regards,  Brian Murphy  General Manager

Summary: I only stayed one night at this hotel and it was fine. The front desk woman was incredibly attentive and helpful. After checking in, we noticed the lock on the door of our room didn't work. I called the front desk and they had someone up there within 5 minutes to fix it.  The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, but the mattress was a little worn in. The neighborhood is fine (much, much better than the neighborhood for the Holiday Inn and Suites about two blocks away) and there are some restaurants right across the street.  All in all, it's a fine place for a short stay, but I wouldn't have enjoyed it as much for a longer stay.

I stayed in 100s of Marriotts over the years.  This property is tired and need of a massive face lift.  Poor might be a little harsh, perhaps "below average" would be better.  The concierge lounge was also disappointing.  Workforce was excellent, but ownership here isn't interested in being even an average Marriott.  Might be an average Fairfield property, with a Marriott name.  I won't stay here again.

I wish I could give this hotel a 3.5. It's an older hotel and though the lobby and common areas are good enough, the room looked really 90's. I booked the room using point saver points, but they upgraded me to a large corner room, which was nice of them, AND they gave me two free drink vouchers at the restaurant. I didn't end up sleeping here since I live 4 miles away, and we booked the room only to let the kids use the pool. The location is right across the street from Cal State Fullerton. We ordered food from Habit burgers across the street. Yummy. There is also a Flame Broiler and a sandwich store. We brought it over to the pool where the kids swam and ate. Later, we ordered a special from their restaurant for a large pizza and a pitcher of soda for $15. Service at the

Leaving tomorrow - I have been at the hotel since last Friday for business. I cannot comment on room rate as that is being picked up by the boss directly. The breakfast buffet was very good, priced at $14. We didn't eat there for any other meal so we can't comment further. The room was very well appointed - the bedding was clean, the toiletries were first rate, and the room had a 42" flat screen HD TV. Wireless internet was free and worked well (in fact, I'm using it now!).  Good work desk.  However, the most amazing part of our stay was the staff. To a person, every single staff member we interacted with was genuinely courteous and helpful. The restaurant staff was wonderful and met our every need. The front desk staff - both the day staff and the afternoon-evening staff,

The elevator and halls smelled like someone had recently vomited in them. The choices in the restaurant were extremely limited while the prices were excessive considering other alternatives within short walking distance of the hotel. Despite being a frequent user of Marriott properties, I was charged $10 for a refrigerator for one night.
Manager Response: Dear Gentle Person, I would like to thank you for taking the time to write about your experience.  It is feedback like yours that provides us the opportunity to make adjustments to our performance enabling us to provide all of our guests with a restful and relaxing experience. I appreciate your candor and would ask the Trip Advisor users to look at the pages of positive reviews that have been given to our location.  I understand that there are going to be instances that hinder an enjoyable visit and would ask to kindly reach out to me personally to discuss further as this type of experience isn’t typical of our property which the countless other reviews attest to.   To this point we did identify an odor on one of our floors, which we immediately resonded to having the carpets professionally cleaned.     Thank you again for providing us with your feedback, allowing us the opportunity to learn and grow as hospitality professionals and assure this hotel remains one of the best Marriott Hotels in the country.  Warm regards,  Brian Murphy  General Manager

Summary: the room was good, clean but was a little too tight. very quite too

Summary Heading: The place to stay in Fullerton ... close to everything
Summary: Enjoyed the room ... spacious and clean.  The bed was a little too firm.  The staff was friendly and helpful and the restaurant staff too.  We enjoyed all the breakfasts and had a dinner there.  It was delicious.
We experienced a very enjoyable stay @  your hotel. The food was great @ the restaurant( ha penny?)   I am looking forward to staying there more often.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay in Fullerton
Summary: The beds were comfortable, the room was nice. The only problem was that there was some freeway noise. We had a room in the front on the 3rd floor. Not sure if you could get away from it on another floor. The staff was very polite and efficient.

My stay was very comfortable.  The rewards 'You tidy we reward' is a great idea!  I was so glad there was a workout room, although small, but modern equipment.  The restaurant was quite good; didn't expect hotel food to be that great, but I was pleasantly surprised.  I was, however, dissappointed by the lack of a 'happy hour' as indicated by the receipt.  I asked the waitress at the bar and she had no idea what I was talking about.
This is a fantastic property - AMAZING staff - everyone greets you by name, very helpful - I love the 'you tide - we reward' promotion - convenient to my office - I would NEVER stay anywhere else.

Really enjoyed our stay!  Rooms were clean, the bed was so comfortable...we didn't want to leave!  The staff was awesome and so eager to help.  We ate at the restaurant and loved it!  Couldn't be more satified with our stay.
Very helpful & caring staff. Enjoyable stay. Clean & quiet.
We really enjoyed our stay!  Especially Ana who makes the very best coffee!! Everyone is so helpful and friendly.  It was very nice!

All staff were friendly. Saying have a nice day or hope you enjoy your stay. I actually felt like they meant. Will recommend your hotel to others. But one individual went above and beyond. Thomas checked me in made small talk gave me direction for bookstore on campus. Drew a map for me. Help me pick a place to eat. It/ he was awesome. I run 3 Chick-fil-a's in Houston and our stores have some of the highest customer satisfaction scores in the nation. This guy would fit right in on my hospitality team. Watch out. He has what it takes. I'll be back Ed Murray

Enjoyed our stay at your hotel. We were there for a longer stay than usual. The room was nice, housekeeping did a good job also. Was pretty disappointed that there was not a fridge in the room. We were unable to keep a supply of drinks and snacks due to that. It seems like it's pretty standard anymore to have at least a fridge in room and many times a microwave. We were surprised it was not part of room. We spent a lot of time at hotel because our daughter was one of the Michigan State softball players, spent a lot of time in room with her visiting us. We travel a lot with the team and like to stay where they are staying. We were not willing to pay 10$ extra for hotel to supply us with a fridge. I think our length of stay was long enough to maybe have the little extras included.
Great stay, staff was very helpful, room was very comfortable

Short Review: Friendly and very helpful staff. Good restaurant inside the hotel, and very convenient location for surrounding eateries. Gym is decent Pool area refreshing Shirley in the concierge lounge is absoulutely the best. She is amazing, friendly, and very helpful. This is not the biggest Marriot but it is a very nice one.

Great hotel. We were impressed with the rooms, service, location, etc.   -Location: We were going to a Ducks hockey game and this hotel is just up the highway from there (5-10 minutes).  -Service: Front-desk staff were very friendly and helpful. -Facilities: Nice pool and sauna. Free internet in the lobby worked great. -Parking: Free and right in front of the property. -Rooms: Nicely renovated. Very comfortable beds.  We would definitely stay here again.

I first stayed at this property almost a decade ago and it was good to see that they have kept it updated with the times.  This is a typical business-class Marriott but this kind of property is what Marriott does best.  The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. The rooms were well appointed, clean and comfortable.  There was a large flat-screen TV with a good selection of channels and quite a few were in hi-def.  The wireless internet is not free (unless your plan includes it) but the speed got creepy-crawly slow one evening I was there.  As a Marriott elite I had access to the Concierge Lounge, which served a decent quality breakfast.  I had a meal in the HaPenny restaurant and it was pretty good.  If you need to be in the Fullerton/Anaheim area and don't want to be

We stay at this property just about every time we visit Disneyland (several times each year) and one of the few problems we've ever had is not being able to connect to the internet in certain rooms on the sixth floor.  I'm Platinum Premier with Marriott, so we're always on the sixth floor and have access to the Concierge Lounge which serves a good variety of breakfast foods during the week and has a computer with printer.  They also have snacks, fruit, and drinks (bottled water and soft drinks) out during the day.  We've made a meal out of the evening offering a few times.  Lounge is closed on weekends and we are given breakfast in the restaurant (Ha'Penny).  We usually have the same waiter (for the life of me I can't remember his name!!) and he is very attentive and always

I always stay at the Marriott Fullerton when in the area.  This hotel has excellent facilities for business as well as leisure.  The service of everyone at the hotel is always outstanding.  They really make me feel like they are happy to be there and that they genuinely care about my experience. I am on the road a lot, and it is so nice to stay somewhere where it almost feels like home.

Summary Heading: I love this hotel and their Restaurant
Summary: Thie hotel really wants you to to be pleased. The front desk staff are the best and so helpful with anything you need. I stayed 12 days and dined at their Ha'Penny Restaurant 6 times. The dinners are first class a very good chef. Breakfast omelets cooked for you (even egg white omelets) are the best. Fresh fruit and so many pastries. The rooms are large and very clean. They want to save water so they give you a $5.00 coupon that can be used for dinner or toward your Marriott points. If you come back to the hotel they have a lot of parking but you might have to walk far because they run about 3 events at a time .

We stayed at the Marriott for three nights over the weekend for a quick family vacation.  We travel fairly frequently, and my kids love staying in hotels.  For the most part we are not in our room very often and pretty simple to please.  For the most part the room was fairly clean, and the beds comfortable but small, they are twins and not queen size as stated.  The service was mediocre at best, while they were not rude or unprofessional, they simple did not make any effort to go beyond the basic duties.  The rooms have very thin walls and provide minimal sound proofing.  We asked to be moved as the housekeepers started early, and woke us up every morning knocking on doors and talking.  We had to ask for towels every morning as they only gave us three for a family of four; they

This hotel is a full service hotel. The room we had was quite small but does have a closet. It also had a 36" LCD TV, a work desk and side chair.  The room was clean as well as the carpet. There is in room coffee but no microwave or mini fridge.  We liked the feature of having an adjustable reading light at each side of the bed.  This is in addition to the normal lamps.  Bath & Body Works toliters are featured.  Our check in was fine. Desk personnel was friendly and informative.  We were able to get a great rate of $90 which made the stay even more pleasing.  The room was quiet with a very comfortable bed. There is a $10 charge for internet.  The hotel offers complimentary parking which is great since so many area hotels are charging additional for guest parking.  The grounds

We had a very nice 2 night stay at this hotel.  The location was great for all attractions in this area. We attended the Rose Bowl and also visited friends while there. The room was clean and attractive and the bathroom was very nice and clean. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, exactly what I expect from a Marriott
Summary: We stay at the Marriott Fullerton for 9 nights and we had a terrific experience. Thank you everyone including Gabriel, Lucy, Nick and Teresa - The hotel is super clean, quiet (the U was closed for the Holidays) and breakfast was affordable for this type of hotel.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel - what one expects from a Marriott!
Summary: We made a last minute reservation at this hotel - and were very happy with the room and the amenities.  The check-in was smooth and the room was very clean and very comfortable.  The only real complaint I have is that Marriott is one of the few chains that still charges for wi-fi service.

Summary Heading: WORST SERVICE FROM A MARRIOT HOTEL
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel two times before going to Disney Land with my family and have received horrible customer service each time.  During my first stay a few months ago, a fire alarm went off and everyone was evacuated from their rooms. Over an hour later, we were notified that it was permissible to return to our rooms without any explanation for the entire ordeal. I later found out from a fellow guest that the fire alarm was activated due to a guest raising the spa temperature too high. The lack of explanation is unacceptable customer service etiquette.  During my second stay, my car was parked near the front entrance of the hotel and was broken into over night. We were not notified by any of the staff during the next morning of our broken window. After going back into

Summary Heading: Overpriced - better choices in the Area
Summary: Only stayed there because I needed the nights to maintain my elite status. Hotel is an old Marriott.   Rooms were OK -- nice TV and good bed.    Prices are very HIGH.  Exec lounge was nice, staff friendly and food in the exec lounge was actually good. Checkout was quick and easy especially for my 6 am flight out of LAX, Parking is free.

Wonderful Hotel. I will definitely be back again. Great location, super comfy bed for a great night’s sleep, friendly staff, and an excellent workout room. Enjoyed getting my Starbucks latte in the morning, made just the way I like it! The location was perfect for me, as my trip was both business and pleasure. I had easy access everywhere I needed to be. I especially appreciated the staff that always went the extra mile when I had a question, or needed something special. I felt right at home!
Room was clean, bed was comfortable, gym was adequate, checkin/checkout was quick, staff was friendly. Restaurant/bar on sight but did not use. Paid $69 for thursday stay via priceline.

This property is often available as much better rates than other Marriott Full Service Hotels in Orange County.  It is not the best Marriott ever, but is decent.  The facility shows its age a bit, but is convenient to many OC venues, if your don't mind driving a little.  Free parking and helpful staff.

This was a very well located hotel.  The rooms were average, but clean.  There was also a fee for wifi, but overnight parking was free.  This business center was basically just a little cubby near the restrooms, but at least there was a working printer available.  They didn't offer continental breakfast, but there were plenty of choices within in walking distance (basically across the street).  They do offer a limited Starbucks coffee menu at their restaurant...BUT, when I ordered my typical Americano with a pump of caramel, it was basically all water and caramel (pretty gross).  I would rather had just walked across the street to Peets Coffee instead.

Summary Heading: Disappointing, much better choices nearby. You can do better.
Summary: This hotel is one which is in serious need of a rennovation.  In town for business and scheduled to stay for a week. Brought ny spouse with me to enjoy the warm California sun. This was not a great start.  Upon arrival in the hotel area, we decided to stop for a bite to eat. The choices available in the area were underwhelming. Ended up with decent Mexican but geez we are in la. Decent Mexican is not that hard to find.  Parking at this hotel is just weird. There is a small garage in the back of the hotel along with some surface parking back there. Not a problem really but a weird parking arrangement entering the hotel all the time from the back. Anyhow this was definitely not a show stopper So on to the hotel.  I travel a lot for my job. I use a travel agent to book my travel. I

This property lived up to the Marriott name. The front desk associates were more focused on creating a good hospitality experience than some other places I've stayed. The room isn't the most modern I've ever stayed in since the hotel is a little older (I'd guess it is 1970's era), but it was fine, with a spacious bath vanity, large flat screen TV, and very comfortable beds. The gym was better than those I've encountered at most older hotels too. It wasn't like working out in a converted closet. It was a somewhat larger, updated gym with nice perks like cool, scented towels in a small refrigerator. There is good walkability in the area too, with a few dining options you can walk to across the street.

Decent hotel - not as clean as I would have expected for a Marriott but the beds, as usual, were comfy.  Hotel staff was attentive, the restaurant (breakfast) was average fare with a nice touch of the omelet station.  However if you are vegan or vegetarian, the best you could do was fresh fruit.  I can honestly say if I was ever in this part of the world again for a weekend, I would probably stay there.  It was near enough to restaurants, and right near the university.

Summary Heading: Lot of potential, but may take some work
Summary: I booked this hotel 2 months in advance through a discount web site (a lot priceline, etc.).  I reserverd a room with 2 fulls beds, to accommodate me, my spouse, and my 2 children.  We arrived very late (near midnight) and when we checked in were told they only had a king size bed.  When I questioned them, they said that they do NOT honor details from 3rd party web sites, even though nothing on my reservation indicated that.  To add injury to insult, they said there were NO rollaway beds available.  I will say the staff waswilling to bring plenty of sheets and blankets for my children to sleep on the floor.  The next day rollaway beds were available, but they wanted to charge $20 per bed, even though we clearly showed 4 people on our reservation and we had prepaid 10 days.

I liked this hotel - it had a pub, gym and pool.  There is free and plentiful parking for hotel guests.  The hotel interior appears to have newer carpet.  The pool was open past 10pm, which is a plus.  The pub/bar was friendly and inviting, not the usual stiff lobby bar or a super-fancy restaurant bar.  I would stay again.

Summary Heading: More than decent but......I despise Smoking!
Summary: Stayed here two days, 7.30.11 - 8.1.11, and for the price we paid using Priceline, it was an excellent deal. Extremely comfortable King bed. Very clean room; nice swimming pool. Excellent staff. Great Fitness room and swimming pool that opened at 6am which is a bonus.  My only complaint is that the Marriott chain markets their hotels as all Non-Smoking. This hotel had a smokers pit between their hotel back exit door and their pool and I had to walk through all these smokers to get to their pool each morning. I almost passed.  If I were Mr. Marriott, I would completely ban all areas from smokers. Other than that, everything was perfect.  Vince P

Summary Heading: Beautiful grounds.. but charges for Wifi
Summary: Stayed here in July as part as a 10 year anniversary present for my wife. I won the hotel via Priceline for $55 a night which seems fair considering where it was at and the features that it offered. I found the hotel to be beautifully kept and well maintained with ground keepers looking after it all of the time. The room looked like your average Marriott and the air conditioner was running perfectly which was great considering the days were averaging 95+ degrees.  A coffee maker could be seen in the room as well as a bottle of water that was offered for $4. The one biggest disappointment with the room was the $10 per night fee for Wifi access. I have stayed in many other Marriott branded hotels (Residence Inn, Courtyard) that include this in the room rate. Since Fullerton is a

Summary Heading: The good, the bad and the ugly.
Summary: We just finished a weekend stay at this property. There pluses and minuses during our stay.   Plus - Great beds and bedding, very quiet, free parking and access to freeway.  Minus - No free Internet or breakfast. Only coffee, no tea in the room. No microwave or refrigerator. Bathroom had no ventilation.  When I requested a receipt at the end of my stay the front desk would not provide one due to the fact that I booked through priceline. I was told I had received my receipt via email when I booked.    Overall the property was fine for the price I paid. However I would not pay full price for this hotel.    Additional tip - if your room is located on the side of the hotel near cal state you can log into their guest network for free.

The rooms are quite luxurious for the price, which was discounted because I was attending a wedding.  Great bedding and really nice decor as you can see in my pictures.  Bathroom was also great.  The free breakfast was a nice touch (but it tasted somewhat bland--and the breakfast area was quite empty.)  It was not centrally located to too many shops.  My only complaint was that I was awoken up at 7 am by some loud screaming next door, apparently the walls are thin and the couple didn't think anyone was listening.  Let's just say, they should put more insulation in the walls.  Other than that, I would definitely stay here again if I were attending any events or for business.

Summary Heading: No perks for elite members. Is a franchise.
Summary: We stay here a lot, but now that the perks for elite has been downgraded, we stay elsewhere more.  Breakfast for gold members is not provided for both members in your party.  As a matter of fact, they don't even offer it to you unless you ask for it and then usually you get it for one of you.  That is when the concierge is not open.  We go on weekends so elite perks are non existent.   I am so tired of contributing and being loyal so much to become elite only to have more and more perks being taken away.  All we want is breakfast for corn's sake!
Manager Response: Dear valued guest, I want to thank you for staying with us at the Fullerton Marriott at California State University and especially for letting me know, understand and respond to your concern regarding the lack of a free breakfast on your weekend stays.   Marriott Hotels and Resorts require all of our properties to strictly adhere to Brand Standards so there is a consistent guest experience throughout our hotels.   Platinum and Gold member benefits allow complimentary continental breakfast on weekdays only and this is why you were not offered our complimentary continental breakfast as it isn’t available on weekends.  We certainly value your business and perhaps this is something that will be explored in the future but unfortunately until this standard changes we must remain compliant with our brand standards.   At your service,  Brian Murphy  General Manager

Summary Heading: Good service, clean room, nice breakfast
Summary: The room is very clean and there was a nice artwork hanging on the wall. (Probably most rooms? I am not sure)  :I did aerobic exercise with fitness DVD in the room. It was really nice!  If you don't have a car, you really need this at the hotel like this because   there is nothing fun within the walking distance of this hotel.     : Breakfast buffet in the restaurant was super nice. Nice orange juice.  Pancake, omlette, they make it in front of you. Also, servers were really nice and polite.   : A lady at the front desk was really helpful for me arranging  the shuttle to the airport.

Summary Heading: Are you sure this is a Marriott?
Summary: This is one that must just barely meet the qualifications for a marriott. Feels like one of the cheaper brands perhaps upgraded to a full fledge hotel.  My problem was the rate I booked included some vouchers for future travel. When I arrived I was told I had booked some other rate that I had never heard of and could never had done on my own.   So not sure where the breakdown was, but was made to feel like the problem was my fault.    I tried over and over and over to resolve with them, but could never get anyone to return my calls.   So if you're looking for indifference this is the right place for you.   They never did resolve or even address my problem.
Great rooms, beds are the most comfortable anywhere.  The LG TV is great.  Only compliant they parking spots to college students and forces you to use handicap spots.

Best thing about the Fullerton Marriott is the location -- just a couple hundred yards from the freeway and in the other direction, just a couple hundred yards from CSUF. The rooms are very quiet despite being so close to the freeway.   There's room for improvement -- the mattress was a bit soft, towels were more of the locker room variety, and shower pressure was merely ok. Restaurant was average. Free parking, but in-room internet and business center internet not free.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, I would like to thank you for staying with us at the Marriott Fullerton and for taking the time to write about your experience while staying with us.  It is feedback like yours that helps us evaluate how we are doing and allow us the opportunity to make the appropriate and necessary adjustments to provide all of our guests with a restful and relaxing experience.  Yes we are a very unique property with a fantastic location close to Cal State Fullerton, Disneyland, and Knott’s Berry Farm, Honda Center, Angel Stadium and many other local attractions.  Thank you for noticing this.  To your point of room to improve, we have discovered some towels that were past their life expectancy and have been eliminating and replacing them as we identify them.  We also have a new Chef and have seen some great changes in our restaurant.  And yes we did experience a slight problem with our water pressure but resolved this issue with great expediency.   Thank you again for giving us the feedback we thirst for, allowing us the opportunity to learn and grow as hospitality professionals and assuring this hotel remains one of the best Marriott Hotels in the Western region.

Summary Heading: Poor Service.  Do Not Book Here Especially for your Wedding Night and for Group Block
Summary: I got married couple days ago, so I used this hotel for all my guest to stay in.  From the beginning, I received very poor customer service.  My sales representative did not keep in contact with me.  I called them about 2 to 3 times a week for a month.  Finally on Monday, the week of my wedding, my sale representative FINALLY decides to call me.  I spoke to them about how disappointed I was in their service and all they said was 'I understand" and nothing more.  We booked a lot of rooms with them.  So, on top of the fact that they did not provide any special accommodations (no free suite or good discount on it, no free champagne, no rose petals, nothing..  I even asked couple times...)  for my husband and I on our wedding/honeymoon night, they did not give out all our special

Summary Heading: The best and worst of times
Summary: I'd love to say I loved this place, but can't.  The staff were wonderful, all very helpful and friendly.  We were there for a birthday party for my 90 yr old great aunt and they were right on top of everything at that event.  They were great at the desk, housekeeping, maintenance and resturaunt.  The room was quite small with a view of the parking garage but it was spotless which I alway appreciate.  What didn't work for me were a few things.  I realize that the hotel takes the guests they can get but we were the only adults on a floor of 12-18 year old church kids.  You would think they would have split the kids or put us somewhere else. They ran up and down the hall all night and kept both myself and my 80 yr old mom up for two nights.  We actually left a night early just to

Summary Heading: Caution: Hotel does not honor confirmed rate
Summary: This is one of many Marriott branded hotels that offer lower  publicly available rates outside Marriott reservation channel. If you spot such a rate, you  are eniteled to a 25% discount of lower rate if you use Marriott's Look No Further® Best Rate Guarantee program.  Problem was: Hotel does not accept this rate and charged me a three times higher rate. As most travelers don't like to waste time at Small-Claims Courts or with lengthy communications at corporate level, I cannot recommend to stay at this hotel, if rate is an issue for you.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms. Better than expected and reasonable price.
Summary: Great beds, big flat screen TV's , comfortable workspace and a decent price.   A safe choice in Fullerton.

Ignored comments made by 800-number...(have never never ever heard of that)... said "I don't care what it says...the 800-number is wrong to say that".  Rooms are OK. Mid to high-end LG flat-screen TV (looks like the standard Marriott specified TV), but since the signal is analog, the capabilities of the TV are inhibited. I've seen HD on the same model at the Irvine Marriott and the TV is capable of so much more.  Breakfast was free; otherwise I'd say it's $15 price was about $8 overpriced. Restaurant coffee sux. Tastes like Maxwell House. Definitely not Sbucks.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am pleased that you had a good stay with us. I am sorry that you did not like the coffee we serve. We do have Starbuck’s in our bar. If you visit us again in the future you can request this from our service staff. They will be happy to assist you.   I wanted to take the time to update you on our HD TV conversion. I am please to say that we are currently undergoing this upgrade. We have been on a waiting list for about a year and our property finally came up on the list. The conversion to HD will be completed on December 22, 2010.    I hope that you will come and visit us again when you are in the area.

Summary: This is a usual Marriott property. The rooms are clean and appointed as all Marriotts are. The parking is a bit problematic here as it seems that they sell parking permits to the college students and so it is a bit hard to find a good spot to park if it is during school hours or events. There was a conference there the week I stayed and it was nearly impossible to find a spot. The restaurant is ok, but has a very limited offering.

Summary Heading: It's an antiquated Marriott that stays alive because of the college.
Summary: I think the only reason this Marriott survives is due to the college business, i.e. they fill the place up with parents visiting as well as your business traveler. This is not the place to stay if you are looking for a get away. I stayed here because it was close to my customers and traffic is bad and I wanted to be close.

A very clean wonderful hotel stayed there 10 days.Very quiet and front desk was very knowlegable with directions etc, They have a lot of business meetings going on in the banquet rooms so at night you have to park in the garage and walk but at least they don't charge.Ate 4 times in the Irish pub because there are not a lot of restaurants in the immediate area and did not enjoy any of the meals in fact they were really not good at all and not a big selection. The lobby is very pretty and housekeeping is good but drive a little to downtown Fullerton for dinner,Yes I would stay there again.I had my own computer but you have to pay to use the computer in the business office

We spent 3 nights in this Marriott while visiting friends in the area.  The hotel was well located in Orange County for our purposes and provided an excellent base to branch out and visit the surrounding area.  The rooms were clean, quiet and well appointed, pretty much what you expect from a Marriott.  We used the fitness center which was also pretty much what you expect from a Marriott.  We did not use the pool or the restaurant but they were available.  The hotel was a great value at $75.00 a night, my only complaint is they charge an additional $10 a night for internet service and it seems to me they should just included it in the price of the room.  We would certainly stay here again.
Friendly professional staff; fine breakfast; clean and classy room.  One of my best Marriott visits.  I would stay here again.

We stayed At Fullerton Marriott  because of the World Art Foundation 09 Expo for 5 nights. Ofelia at the Front Desk was absolutely amazing in her service to us. I felt like she was an old friend of mine. Always ready to help me in whatever I need. We travel with our three children and in this situations a lot of things are necessary for a busy mom! And Ofelia was always at hand with her smile and charisma!  At the restaurant we felt like in family. Gabriel, Juan and Israel served us always with a big smile and ready to pleased my three children with a lot of patience! They are great.  And Elvia, -room cleaning- was always friendly and always ready to help me. This was a great and positive experience! Congratulations. The most positive asset you have is your STAFF! I wish all the
I checked into the hotel in the evening hours.My stay was good.I stayed for one week and everything seems to be good.

Have stayed here 4-5 times, every year for a meeting, and lots of plusses. !) Great staff -always very helpful, very professional--how you wish all hotel staff were! 2) Free wi-fi in the reception/check-in area, and lots of places to sit and work...I know--free wi-fi in the rooms would be even better, but I was pretty happy w/ the public area wi-fi 3) Nice, adequately outfitted gym area - and NO CHARGE for that  4) Nice little touches like the apples at the front desk, fruit-infused ice water in the lobby, and coffee on the weekends  Food is actually pretty good in the restaurant, albeit a bit privey. Only downside I can say is that altho they have a Starbucks in the bar area of their lounge, they almost never have someone staffing it--they are always very willing to go & find

I stayed at this property for 3 nights and it was everything you should expect from a full-service Marriott.  The room was clean.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The restaurant had acceptable food and was open late.  I arrived late on a Sunday night and was pleasantly surprised that the restaurant served until midnight.  If I got back to the area in the future, I'll definitely stay there again.

I stayed at the Fullerton Marriot on February 14 as I was visiting some relatives in the area.  I paid a rate of $116 with my AAA card.  All in all the hotel was nice.  The staff was friendly and I was able to check in early (at around 1130am) and the requests that I had made via the virtual concierge (extra pillows, high floor room) were waiting for me when I arrived.  The rooms were great, with comfy beds, nice linens and a large plasma screen TV.  The only complaints I had were that the robes that were supposed to be in the room were not and the TV only had about 15 channels.  I also wish they had free high speed internet.  If the price was right I would stay here again.

I stay at hotels in the area to visit family during the holidays, and I chose to stay at the Marriott because it was a little bit cheaper than other hotels in the area. We stayed during thanksgiving and couldn't have been more unimpressed. First, the hotel is almost underneath the freeway (I can't believe people haven't mentioned this before). Check- in was slow, the breakfast they had in the morning was very bare bones and lackluster. The outside of the hotel doesn't look very appealing.  Lastly, there is nothing in the area food wise that is really very good.  I decided to try out the Embassy Suites Brea when my husband and I came down for Christmas, and although it was a little bit more expensive, it was a much nicer hotel, with much better accommodations! They have free

The manager bent over backwards to make our stay very pleasant. The hotel was booked and we needed to check in by 1:00 p. m. and it did not look possible, but 20 mins later the manager said, he could put us in a suite and get us checked in. Wow! That was great. Plus everything I need after that, the staff took care of right away. My grandkids live near by and I have always enjoyed and looked forward to my stay here, very clean, quite and all around comfort; lobby, pool, weight room & etc. Plus, there brunch is one of the best; it is an added treat during my visit.

I went to northern Orange County on a family visit, and didn't particularly want to stay in the bustle of the Disneyland area.  I chose this hotel because of its #1 status on TripAdvisor.  All the reviews are accurate; check-in went smoothly with no waiting.  Hotel personnel were ALWAYS friendly and helpful.  My room was spotlessly clean and in perfect condition.  There was a bottle of Fiji drinking water if I wanted to pay $5 for it.  That, along with the few items in an alcove next to the front desk, was more than just a bit overpriced so I went to the mini-market nearby (there's several of them just under the 57 freeway overpass on Nutwood) for whatever provisions I needed.  I'm allergic to feather down pillows and awoke the second morning with my eyes all red and puffy.  A

I stayed here for two nights for a friend's wedding and was really quite surprised at how nice the place was. Now this is no Four Seasons but I had a standard room for less than $120/night and it really was nicely appointed. The room was completely updated and the bed and bedding were excellent quality. I ordered room service and the prices were reasonable. I would certainly stay here again.

Absolutely amazing...staff is accomodating and the manager is great!  Great for business travellers especially.  This is my most favorite hotel...and I've been to alot of really nice hotels.  More of a quaint unexpected treat!

We visited the Fullerton Marriott as part of a group attending a local soccer tournament.   First impression: Very good location, right off the 57 freeway at Nutwood. There is construction going on, so getting into the lot was a little tricky, but there was ample parking in the lot/parking garage.  Checkin went well. There were a couple people in line ahead of us, and we waited only about 5 minutes. We were given our room, a map, and we were on our way. We got to our room and someones stuff was still in there. They obviously had not checked out. We went back downstairs and told them. They were surprised, of course, to find out that that room was still occupied. They didnt have any other rooms available with 2 beds. Would we take a 1 bed room? I said I would rather not, because I

On a family trip to Disneyland I was able to Priceline the Marriott, Fullerton. +++   Conveinient hotel near many freeways.   +++   Free Parking +++   Beautiful Decor +++   Most comfy plush beds and bedding ever.  My husband and I had the best sleep ever...it was like you were home. +++   Friendly and informative staff. ++    Not as close to Disneyland than preferred but still an excellent stay for the value.  (About 7 miles from the mouse.  Front desk has preprinted maps available to the park, dining and banks)

Had a one-night business trip stay in mid December 2005.  The hotel is just off the freeway and has free parking.    Had a nice room that was recently renovated.  Everything was redone with the exception of the shower/tub.  My room faced away from the freeway and was very quiet.  My only complaint was the stale smoke odor from previous occupants.  It was noticeable but tolerable.  The buffet breakfast was good and is typical of what I have encountered at other full service Marriotts.  Lots of business travelers during my stay.  Seemed like an upscale crowd.  They have a good sized outdoor swimming pool and a jacuzzi.  I usually stay in the Anaheim area but will consider this location for future stays.  The key is to try to dodge the peak commute times (which can be a challenge).

My sister and I stayed at this Marriot during the last weekend in October 2005. It was accessible to the freeway. The room amentities were above average, with updated, modern decor and confortable beds. Service was good, even granting a late check out on our last day.   There are two restaurants across the street, one Indian and one sports bar. We ate at the Indian restaurant, Taal, and had an excellent meal and service.  The Brea Mall is just a few miles away via the freeway. This hotel was an excellent choice for our stay and recommend it to anyone who will be visiting the Fullerton campus or area.

Really good deal at this hotel for the room price. Clean,newer furniture and comfortable bed. Although it was supposed to be non-smoking I could start smelling the smoke an hour or so after I got to the room and ran the air.  Resturant was ok- a little slow on a slow night.  Parking is good and you can drive to a good mall in a few minutes that has some resturants (Cheesecake Factory, etc)  I would say a good value for the price and a very low key hotel.

Stayed there for 4th of July weekend. Very clean, comfortable bed/linens. Covered Parking that is free. Easy access to freeway. Not close to theme parks but not too far either. Stay here and be reassured you will not have any unexpected "suprises"(letdowns/complaints).

This hotel was great!! The front desk staff was great! A clerk named Michael was the best there!! He helped us find a great restaurat, and even gave us perfect directions to several places nearby that we needed to go to. Michael was warm and friendly and by far our favorite person there!!The front desk manager Lori was also a great help to us as well as Laine during the evening!! What a wonderful place to stay!!!

I also booked my stay at the Fullerton Marriott through priceline, and got an excellent deal.  I have no hesitations recommending this hotel.  Although the room we received was not perfect (some wear on carpets and walls), it was impeccably clean.  Our king size bed was quite comfortable, and the bathroom was pretty standard, but also perfectly clean.  The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful, and eager to provide directions to local restaurants and attractions.  Disneyland was only a few minutes away, and mostly non-highway driving.  The free parking garage was convenient as well, but our room was near the exit.  Didn't try the restaurant due to the prices, but being next to the college there are plenty of amenities nearby.

Summary Heading: Fullerton?  But it's so far away from Disneyland!
Summary: One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at, and the best one that I have ever obtained on Priceline over the past two years.    VERY COMFORTABLE BEDS, well designed rooms and bathrooms.    Easily a relaxing stay for the most discriminate guest.  No parking charges, and not that far from Disneyland..

This is the best hotel to stay at in the area. Free parking. Easy access to freeways, great service concoerge level for marriott members.  Great little lobby bar to eat at and get a bite to eat. If you are going on business or leisure stay here!!!!!

Clean, quiet, classy and affordable. This hotel gets my vote. Have spent numerous nights in the Fullerton/Anaheim/Buena Park area and I truly love this place. Easy access to the freeway to nearby Disneyland, The Pond, Knotts, Nixon Library and Anaheim Stadium. A well kept-secret need not be kept secret anymore. See you there!
